Charlie S. 08/06/2021 7:32 PM
Sign Boards In addition to Hyperion's announcement here. Yes, the Development Team are aware of the permission issues the Smart Signs have at the moment, however, this should not be abused by any Member. The use of these signs by Law Enforcemnt for pertinent / realisitc information is absolutely fine for the time-being, however, the use by Civilians in an "excessive" amount, is not. Civilians may use these in small amounts for Roleplay situations, but plastering a message through 5+ Signs, for example, is not. Please excersise common sense whilst punishing Member's / using them yourself. Signed, Community Owner - Charlie S.
San Andreas Roleplay

You are to direct them to #📩・staff-reports channel. 11
101 | Hyperion 08/08/2021 6:40 PM
[ @SARP | Server Staff ] [ Easy Admin Update ] All, After the next restart we should have a new version of EasyAdmin. This update changes a few things and adds new features. Clear (cars, props, preds) - This option will allow you to clear abandoned cars and props in a small area. If you are clearing cars it may take a few attempts to clear multiple cars. To clear props you must make sure all players have left the area and then use the menu command to clear props. You must also leave the area once the command is done for them to actually clear. Using this new car clear by area option should help lower the amount of actual server wide car clears which interrupts role play. While you are staffing go around and use the clear car option in the easy admin menu to clear groups of cars that you see abandoned. Again, you may need to hit it a few times to clear multiple cars. Overall this should be much easier than having to delgun or /dv cars you find. Also, staff will only see staff calls in chat if they are actually onduty as staff by using the /staffduty command. Thanks. (edited)

101 | Hyperion 08/09/2021 5:18 PM
[ @SARP | Server Staff ] [ Dual Clanning ] All, It is very important that you all read and acknowledge this. Up until this point we have been generous with our dual clanning policy. However today information came to light that several current staff members were high command or management level in another server that both has a similar name to us and appeared to have copied information from this server. Because of this, the dual clanning policy has been updated to the following: ➤You may not hold the following roles/positions if dual clanning in another server:
- Owner/Management - Coordinator - Staff Team - Development Team - Support Team - High Command.
If any of you are currently holding these roles in another server you must declare it now. If it found after the fact it will likely mean removal. You may continue to dual clan as a LEO/FD/COMMS/CIV department member or department supervisor in another server but that is the limit. You of course must also maintain your hours here as well. Thanks. (edited)

101 | Hyperion 08/21/2021 3:20 AM
[ @SARP | Server Staff ] [ Staff using non-staff personals ] All, please read and review this new addition to the staff guidelines. It is effective immediately. Short version: You can trade/use other staff member's personals with their permission, but you can not trade/use non-staff member's personals.
➤ 30. Staff members may not engage in the trading or use of other non-staff member’s paid personal vehicles. This constitutes a conflict of interest and opens the door for abuse of power and favoritism. ➤ 30.1 You may still drive/trade personals with other staff members.
Thanks. (edited)

This Head Administrator has never complained about 1 thing, instead provided problems backed by a solution every time. I can deeply and truly say that this Member deserves this promotion fully, and I can confidently say that he will fulfill these shoes as they should be. As you all may be wondering what position will this individual get, and if you have not figured it out yet, who this individual may be? I can proudly say that our second management promotion will be awarded to..... drum roll..... @308 | Grandpa KC 🚔 Mr. Casey will be full-filling the position of Community Coordinator. He will be tasked as a liaison between the community and the server's Management Team. He will be responsible for keeping intact the server's moral by hosting community meetings, competitions, votes and more! His position will also act as an advocate for the community, advocating for the concerns of all members. The Community Coordinator will also be heavily involved in the in-game operations of the server by ensuring quality of role-play is a top priority! Everyone Please congratulate @308 | Grandpa KC 🚔 for his hard work and dedication it has taken him to get here. This will also leave one Head Administrator Position open within the staff team, so everyone stay tuned for more promotions. Signed, Community Ownership

Charlie S. 08/23/2021 8:04 PM
My Future at the San Andreas Roleplay Community Good evening ladies & gentlemen, I know this may come as a shock to many within the Community, however, with great sadness, I inform you that, I will be Retiring from the San Andreas Roleplay Community's Management & Owernship team, as of Thursday, Septerber 2nd, 2021. Behind the Management Team, and Head Administrators, the High Command Teams & Staff Team are the third in-line to be informed about this decision of my own. Like stated just a moment ago, I know this will come as a shock, however, this is completely the right decision for myself, and for the future of myself beyond video games. Although there were several letters giving a more comprehensive breakdown of this decision, I do not feel comfortable releasing that information beyond the High-Staff team, but out of respect, I will go into a little detail in the paragraph below. My Statement
Firstly, my time contraints. Over the last year, with Covid-19 causing mass lockdowns throughout the UK, it had severely opened up my schedule for the Management of the San Andreas Roleplay Community, right through these times, from the very opening of the Community, to date, I have been spending a significant amount of time working to build, improve, and sustain the Community, we have since built, when in-turn, sacrificing a few other of my major responsibilites I hold, at my age. Generally college, work, and overall well-being. Now, with a new academic year approaching, a few serious changes need to be made with my time, so I can focus on what really is important for my family, friends, & myself. Secondly, my passion for FiveM. I've been around the FiveM scene for almost 2 years now, and I've loved every minute of it. But, over the past few months, I've lost my drive, passion, and overall ambitions for FiveM. I've tryed to push through that, but it's not the type of person I am. If it's something I no longer enjoy, feel content, or gratified with; regardless of the privileges that coincide with it, it's something that I need changing.
Referring back to earlier, this is what I, myself, feels comfortable releasing to the wider Community, so take the above statement with a grain of salt. However, with that statement; rumors, are not what should be produced from this. There is absolutely nothing that has swayed me towards this decision than the benefit of my own future beyond the realm of Community's, video games, etc. I have loved every minute of being part of this Community, getting to know the many great people & talents that many spend their days here at what we have built. It's truly amazing, and it's truly a shame that I cannot continue my journey here. It has been a true pleasure working for alongside each Member, past and present, to bring us to what we are today. For those that know me, or those that don't, I wish you the best of luck in wherever your future lands you. I want to give an especial thank you to our current Management Team, you guys are some of the most talented individuals in all completely different respects, making us what has been, an unbeatable force. I hope you understand & repsect my decision here today. Over the next coming weeks, I will slowly be transition the Ownership of the Server, to the second in Command Alex M. & the rest of the Management Team. Although with my absense, what I can assure is the fluid transition of all assets, to allow the Community to continue to strive in the same way it has for the last 5-months, the Management Team will continue operating in the way that we have led it so far, and there should be near fear amongst anyone, in regards to the direction of the Community. In regards to this announcement, as per usual, all contents must remain internally amognst the Staff Team. Cheers! Best Regards, Community Owner - Charlie S.
San Andreas Roleplay - @SARP | Server Staff

101 | Hyperion 08/26/2021 2:45 AM
[ Staff Suspensions ] All, There was a anonymous suggestion submitted requesting that staff announcements not be made regarding suspensions as it causes gossip and drama. So the reason they are announced is two fold. Firstly, we believe in transparency and being open as to the actions being taken against staff when it comes to disciplinary issues. Secondly, we hope that the "reasons" posted in the suspensions will help deter other's from making the same mistakes. Everyone makes mistakes, the announcements are not to embarrass those who are suspended, they are to promote awareness and inclusion for the team. However, since the suggestion was made I would like to hear from you guys. I will place a poll below this message, please vote your feelings on the matter and I will take it into consideration. This does not mean it will change the protocol however I would like to know the team's overall thoughts. Thanks.
101 | Hyperion
used /poll
Dyno BOT 08/26/2021 2:46 AM
Staff Suspensions
1️⃣ Announce 2️⃣ Don't Announce

Charlie S. 09/02/2021 4:33 PM
Update on my Retirement Good evening Staff Team. Popular to contrary belief and my name of the picture slightly above, I have decided to terminate my two-week notice from the San Andreas Roleplay Management & Ownership Team effective as of today, which would have been my Retirement Date. Over the last two-weeks, I had taken a step away from the Community for the first time in 5-months, and had time to reflect on my time here, and the decision I was actually making. Throughout this time, the Management Team, and Members of the Staff Team have been great, to take some of the responsibilites I held, that were taking a heavy toll on me & my time. To be brutefully honest on myself, my notice was rather brash, and I shouldn've voiced my concerns to the Team earlier on. I couldn't thank them more for their work over these last two-weeks. Learning from these mistakes, I plan to carefully maintain my time inside & out of the Community, so I can reach my ambitions, whilst still working alongside this great Community, so this doesn't happy again. After getting back on the Server Dev'ing again today, for the first time in a while, I felt fresh, and revitilised, and to be honest, raring to go. So with that in mind, Smit is back in action to solve your problems. I even felt good playing with Carcol's. I apologise for playing around with member's of the Management Team & Community, it wasn't an intention of mine at all. If you have any questions, please let me know! Thank You for your understanding! Signed, Community Owner - Charlie S.

101 | Hyperion 09/04/2021 7:29 AM
[ Bot's & Commands ] All, Using the premium version of Dyno aka "SARP | Staff Bot" I've taken some time to set up it's automod and staff commands sections to better fit us. I've also removed the previous SARP |SpamBot as once set up properly, Dyno can accomplish the same thing with deleting links but also showing you the actual link that was posted so that we know if they need to be banned or not. With that said, most of the commands will stay the same. All the /commands will remain the same with a few extras. I've also created a #🔷・discord-automod log which shows all the actions the automod function is taking and will help show us if we need to follow up on anyone being muted or things being prevented/deleted. Automod is set up to handle: Racist Terms Links Image, emoji, zalgo, sticker, and fast text Spam(s) Mass mention Things of note: Dyno is now "/" e.g. /mute /ban /warn <Discord ID> Carl is now "?" e.g. (used for temproles / backup staff bot Carl will serve as the backup bot so if dyno is down you can use ?mute ?warn etc in the same way. Very Important: If we are ever to be raided in some way an you need to lock down ALL public channels remember the command /lockdown and /lockdown end. /lockdown will lock all public channels and no one will be able to post anything. /lockdown end will unlock all public channels and they may resume posting. I will update the #deleted-channel for discord as well. (edited)
4
Charlie S. 09/04/2021 9:26 AM
Venom Anti-Cheat Good morning all. We apologise for the inconvience of Venom Anti-Cheat going "down" last night, this was down to our 1-month trial subscription that we purchased, running out. We have since taken the decision to purchase a lifetime license for this Anti-Cheat, as a very small margin of Modder's made it through the system! With that in mind, there should be no worry about Modder's again, touch-wood. Thanks for your time! Update - 16:30 British Summer Time Venom Anti-Cheat is back up & running. Signed, Community Owner - Charlie S.

101 | Hyperion 09/04/2021 9:08 PM
[ Staff Suspension ] All, Zach J has been issued a 24hr staff suspension and a strike for violating server rules, new life rule, self revive. Thanks. Reminder: If the game registers you down you must stay down until you are medically treated by EMS/FD or a by stander is able to control your bleeding and help you up. Only then can you revive and be taken to a medical center. You cannot revive and continue to fight, shoot, stab etc.. You may also RP your death, wait a bit for medical if available then respawn to a new location and life. The only exception is RDM/VDM in which case you should deal with it as a staff sit. Thanks.
101 | Hyperion 09/05/2021 1:22 PM
[ Mass Pinging ] Due to yesterday’s mass staff pings I went ahead and removed the ability for anyone to ping staff ranks. The only publicly pingable staff role is the interviewer for obvious reasons. However, anyone with the staff team role should still be able to ping other staff ranks. We’ll see if this helps in the long run against trolls. (edited)

101 | Hyperion 09/05/2021 7:45 PM
[ Staff Promotion Outlook ] I know some of you are wondering when the next round of promos will be so I thought I would take some time to outline the next few weeks. Firstly, thank you to everyone who has been putting in the hours, with more staff and everyone working together we have considerably cut down on the amount of staff pings lately. If we can get enough active staff we may be able to lower the hourly requirement just a hair as well. We are currently at 73 staff members. Once we get into the 80s or 90s we may look at that, but it requires everyone to pitch in. 10
101 | Hyperion 09/06/2021 1:04 PM
[ @SARP | Server Staff ] [ Staff Visibility & Breaking Immersion ] All, we've addressed this in the past but I would like to speak about it once more as Im seeing it more and more. On-Duty staff should be discrete and unseen the majority of the time unless directly handling a staff situation. If you are staffing, wearing a staff shirt or vest you should not be hanging around roleplay scenes. You are not in roleplay when staffing and should be no clipping around watching scenes, looking for members violating rules or responding to calls. I never want to see staff driving around in a staff car for no real reason and or running code for no real reason. The only valid reason to spawn a staff car is to address areas of mass chaos such as calming sandy shores down or moving people away from a banned area. You may also spawn a staff car on a staff sit, especially if its on the side of the road. One thing I noticed lately is traffic stops are being trolled and interfered with quite a bit. If you see a traffic stop and aren't busy, no clip above it and just watch for those who interfere. Let the LEO tell them to leave the scene first but if they refuse and continue to interfere or try to bait the officer into something then feel free to handle it. If you are passively role playing during slow times, do not wear a staff shirt or vest. Wear civilian clothes and you may change back if needed. Remember you are there to foster a positive role play environment, not to interfere with it. Thanks.

101 | Hyperion 09/16/2021 4:58 PM
[ @SARP | Server Staff ] [ Staff Panel System Release ] All,
Over the past week I've been working on a new system that will act as a "hub" of sorts for the staff team. This is a department panel purchased by us from Hamz Development and heavily adapted to fit the needs of the staff team. What is it? Well its a website which grants you permissions based on discord roles, there is no account set up or profile set up needed. You login, connect it to discord via the bot confirmation and you're in. It will show your discord profile, name, rank etc.. If you are promoted for example it will automatically refresh your permissions and rank in the login. What will be use this for? The short answer is, if it performs as well as it appears to. we will use it for many things. Clocking in, tracking hours, strikes, warnings, notes praise and more. It also includes quick forms for LOA requests and staff suggestions. You will also have access to many links to staff documents for quick access. If you are on ban appeals or staff investigations you can load directly into those sections of the forum from the panel. Clocking in I'm sure this will be the biggest question, how will be log in? The #⏰・staff-clockins channel will be moved to where the current clockin channel is, this will show when you clock in via /staff duty in game. Once you leave the server or do /staffduty once again to go off duty and enter roleplay it will then clock you out and total your time in the channel. You will take that time, go to the panel and log it. Thats it. No more clocking in on discord and in game, no more forgetting to clock out or the bot going down. Once you submit a clockin, it will be logged into the system and posted in a channel to show that you logged a clockin and how much time you logged. The panel will track your hours at several intervals. 24hrs, 4 weeks (a month) and all time. On your dashboard you will see the total time for the team and your total time. You will also see total amount of strikes, warnings and praises the team currently has along with the total staff count. There is also a point system built into the panel. Things that will affect your point score are clockins, praises, warnings and strikes. LOA requests will be submitted along with suggestions via the panel and posted in the appropriate channels for review. To updated or end your LOA you will do the same method just choose a different option, which ever applies. If your rank does change in the team you may need to relog in the panel for it to take effect there. We will give this a good week and then talk about any problems or desires that we can implement into. This is an awesome system and I hope you guys enjoy it. As for Admin+ you will have multiple options based on permissions and we will go over them in admin chat. For your first clockin, please log your CURRENT hours that have accumulated in the clockin bot. Use the %data command, find your total and then log that total into the panel, this will give you credit for the hours worked so far this month.
SARP Staff Panel: (Save to your favorites) ➤ https://staff.sarp.team Thanks. (edited)
Staff Panel | Login
Department Panel by Hamz#0001

101 | Hyperion 09/24/2021 5:11 AM
[ Staff Logos & Colors ] All, As you all have noticed logo's have been assigned to all roles in the discord. While this is taking some time getting use to, at least we have a complete list with good quality logos attached so it does not look half ass. However, my OCD is driving me nuts regarding the staff ranks. I prefer things to be uniform and currently we have one set of icons for discord and another for teamspeak and the roster. I would love for everything to match up. I would like to know you thoughts.. Option 1️⃣ - Keep the logos we are using now and keep the staff team red and utilize theses icons in teamspeak as well. Option 2️⃣ - Use the teamspeak icons in discord, and color match the staff ranks to the logo hex color so each time you move up your role color matches your icon color as well. Would mean staff would not be red any longer (with the role icon next to your name you don't necessarily need to be) but would give some color variety to the ranks and match your icon. Option 3️⃣ - I seek professional help for my OCD and try to avoid noticing the difference and we keep using two sets of role icons. Nothing is set in stone, just want your thoughts. (edited)

101 | Hyperion 09/27/2021 1:16 AM
[ End of the month update ] All, Activity Check As we near the end of September I want to remind you all that you have about four days to get your hours in before we do an activity check. Many of you are in danger of being titled as inactive. Those who were titled as inactive last month will be in danger of being removed this month if the minimum hours have not been clocked. Please note that going LOA during the last week of the month will not save you from an activity check if you only clocked a few hours during the majority of the current month. However, if you have clocked 5hrs a week each week up to your LOA you will be considered safe. Alien Ped To clarify something that came up today. Members are not to use the Alien Ped. This is the actual alien ped that looks like the predator not the green body suit which is obviously a human ped. This may change in the future but I wanted to clarify because I know there was some confusion. Staff may not wear the body suits while staffing because they are not a professional representation of the staff team. Peds that can not be used: - Nude peds (never) - Default police/fire/ems peds (never) (pubcop ped obviously ok) - Alien Ped (unless for server event/Management approval) - Zombie Ped (unless for server event/Management approval) - Animal Peds (unless CC or admin+ or Management grants 1 session approval) LEO's Speeding while responding to calls: I wanted to address another issue that has come up tonight. The server rule on speeding is "160+ is only permitted on a highway" however speeding at 100+ in sandy shores or other areas such as paleto or mirror park can also be considered unrealistic driving especially if they are doing those speeds for no reason and or smashing into things. Simply talk to them, ask them to slow down and drive more realistically. If it continues then use discretion and deal with them appropriately. With that said, please use common sense when you see an LEO speeding to a call with lights and sirens on. If they are responding to a call obviously they will be speeding and could likely be driving over 100. If they are driving especially reckless you may consider reporting them to their chain of command, or speaking with them after the roleplay ends however I would not recommend interrupting a roleplay scene or pursuit to warn them for speeding unless they are smashing into people/vehicles and not roleplaying it out. If you guys start to notice a pattern of LEOs going absurd speeds or one individual continually doing it let us know as both LEO 01's are in staff and would be receptive of this information. Server rules do apply to LEOs however again we need to use common sense when dealing with units responding code 3 to calls. In other news: SA promotions will likely be announced later this week so keep an eye out on that. I appreciate all of you guys who dedicate so much time to the team and the server. I hope to keep growing the team so that staffing becomes easier and less intensive for the few. Don't be concerned with retirements, it's a natural part of fivem and any server. We work hard to move good people up into positions they work hard for and continuously recruit new members. With that said the quality of staff members is always first priority and sometimes it takes time to build the team properly. Thanks. (edited)

101 | Hyperion 10/01/2021 1:24 PM
[ @SARP | Server Staff ] [ Various Announcements ] All, Two rather important announcements today. First, as of today we are now on the next tier of FiveM allowing us up to 128 server slots. To be clear about this we will not be raising to 128 any time soon, however we may raise to help accommodate server events, promotion ceremonies etc.. If our server slots are full during normal roleplay we may also raise slots to 75 or 85 ONLY but only if there is sufficient staff on to help over see the increase in players. Senior Admins+ will have access to use the command to raise server slots when needed. Secondly, our discord server now qualifies for discord discovery, meaning more players will be able to find us natively. This will however require all staff members to use 2 factor authentication which likely should be required anyway for security purposes. This will be your 24hr warning, by around this time tomorrow that will be enabled. (To clarify, I believe this will only affect Senior Moderators and up) Here's to progress and future growth!! Thanks. (edited)

We have our guidelines, you all agreed to follow them or face action up to removal. Lets honor that promise. Thank you :).

101 | Hyperion 10/17/2021 6:04 PM
[ Head Administrator Retirement ] All, Please join me in congratulating @Chizza in his retirement as Head Administrator. The role of Head Administrator is currently the highest staff rank in use in SARP, it's also the 3rd highest rank in the entire server. This position is earned by only the most mature, professional and knowledgeable staff members in SARP. Mike came to us in the beginning as a little known trial moderator with a big personality who immediately set himself apart with his overall professionalism, maturity and dedication to the server. Over the next six months Mike proved himself to be both highly active, trustworthy and dependable over and over again. Mike continued to move up the ranks impressing us with each promotion and eventually found himself in the Head Administrator position over the Support Team. Mike has done an exceptional job leading both staff and support teams which has helped us to be a successful server. Mike is one of those guys who you cant really replace, his up beat, motivated and level headed outlook was always appreciated and valued by all. Anything Mike was tasked with, you could guarantee it would be done accurately and efficiently. I would like to personally thank Mike for absolutely everything he has put into our server whether it was staff, support or departments. Mike is simply "the man" when it came to getting things done and brainstorming solutions. Thank you Mike, for six great months. We hope to still see you around in the server or the discord from time to time! As a retired Head Administrator, Mike's name will also be added to the in game "Wall of Honor" in the near future. Mike will retain his roles for the remainder of today, please wish him well in #💬・staff-chat PS... Mike's voice will live on in soundboards from of the many, many VC clips that we have compiled of him saying absolutely absurd things completely not taken out of context… Thanks for the laughs!! - (edited)

101 | Hyperion 10/31/2021 3:49 AM
[ Halloween Info ] [ @SARP | Server Staff ] From server announcements: All, In celebration of Halloween, the server will be allowing normally restricted peds for Halloween fun for the next 24hrs. Members may use the following peds aka "costumes": - Alien - Bigfoot - Zombie - Half dead guard - Any other vmenu monster/scary ped you desire! Please note that nude peds and any ped that appears to impersonate LEOs, FD or EMS are still restricted. Also note that Halloween weather and effects will be toggled on and off throughout the day/night. Enjoy! Also, @SARP | Administrator / @SARP | Senior Administrator / @SARP | Head Administrator Feel free to use Halloween weather throughout the day along with neutral weather which gives a seriously scarry/creepy feel. Please know that Halloween weather causes rain/storm at night so give them a break from time to time. During the day Halloween weather is fine, gives a windy/creepy feel. You can also toggle blackout here and there, but remember that it removes LEO lights as well so don't leave it on for longer than a few mins. Overall if you notice the Halloween effects are starting to annoy people give them a break for a bit. (edited)

Copy our Documents & Discord, in their early stages, to now today, forging evidence against a High Staff Team Member, within the San Andreas Roleplay Community, including threatening myself. ➤ I have taken the executive decision to immediately cut all ties of our Staff Team, from this toxic Community, preventing something like this ever happening again.
This is not a Global Community Blacklist, therefore, general Member's of the Server will not be informed via an Announcement, just the Staff Team. Cheers Guys, have a good night. Signed Community Management

161 | Joseph S. 11/07/2021 4:27 PM
@SARP | Server Staff Retirement All, When I first decided to leave my previous community to help start this server alongside @Charlie S. , @102 | Alex M. , and @101 | Hyperion I was extremely nervous to leave a stable and high position in a server with tens of thousands of people, for a server with less than five people at the time. The deciding factor for me to come was the fact that I knew that the people who were starting it had the best work ethic and determination out of everyone I know. Even after the first week, I knew I had made the right decision. Throughout my time here, I have enjoyed every moment of it. From my time in BCSO, to my time as Head of Support Team, and finally my time as Head of Staff I.A., I have enjoyed every moment of it. The reason I am deciding to step down from my position as Head Administrator isn't because I have lost love for the server or that I have issues with people within it, rather I just have more important responsibilities with school and socially that I no longer have time to dedicate to the server. Throughout my time here my activity has fluctuated significantly, often leaning towards the extremely inactive side of the spectrum. Recently I have noticed that my activity has been very little to none, and I knew it would effect other parts of my life if I made an effort to increase it. Because of this, it is my responsibility to know when to step down and allow someone who can devote more time to the server to take my place. I hope to see you all around the server when I can find time to hop on, and I look forward to seeing the growth of this amazing server and group of people in the future. Signed, Joseph S.

101 | Hyperion 11/09/2021 12:56 AM
[ Staff Time Log Issue ] @SARP | Server Staff All, We have identified a potential issue with the staff panel and the way it tracks hours. It tracks 4 weeks at a time, if you work 5 hours a week every week that's not really an issue. However, if you were to work 15 hours or whatever in one week and then take a bit of a break because you have your 20+ hours total.. There is a chance that when I go to check hours that week you worked 15hrs may drop off if it was your oldest week. This is a case of bad timing to say the least and there is nothing I can do to change that. This may account for the reason some of you disputed your totals this month. If that was the case I apologize. There are really only two options here. Either we keep using it but you guys run the chance of some of your hours dropping off at the time of the activity check or we return to the bot. Note: There is a new reminder feature coming to the bot that will remind you to clock out after a certain amount of time or auto clock you out after a specific time i.e. 2hrs. I feel like you guys should choose since this does have an effect on how your hours are tracked in the panel. 1️⃣ = Keep using the panel. = Use the bot to clock hours. I hope this is the last time we have to address this, unfortunately we did not script this panel and some of the issues have only showed up over time. Thanks, vote w/the above emoji.

101 | Hyperion 11/09/2021 12:18 PM
[ Results ] Alright, going with these results the bot is set up and working. Please see pinned messages in #⏰・staff-clockins channel for the commands. Basically: %Clockin - Clocks you in. %Clockout - Clocks you out. %Data - shows your current total time.

6
101 | Hyperion 11/19/2021 4:45 AM
[ Staff Clockin Auto Logging ] [ @SARP | Server Staff ] All, Today marks the successful competition of a project which started a few weeks ago but has been a desire since the server opened. @115 | Isaac Z. contacted me and wanted to work on codding a bot that could automatically clock all staff hours simply based off the webhook that is generated via the /staffduty command in game. Once the project began Isaac did a phenomenal job coding and laying the ground for the development of this system. Within a week he had a working prototype in a test server! At this point @Zooma was brought in and hit the ground running! Zooma recoded and hosted the bot for us and fine tuned a few loose ends to get the bot ready for main stream use. The bot has been running in the background, quietly tracking hours for you guys over the past few days. Today, we feel it is ready for fulltime use! You no longer need to manually clock in anywhere, only use /staffduty in game. The bot will then give you the onduty role and your hours will be clocked upon going offduty or leaving the server. You may still use %data to see your total hours clocked on the bot. Hours will again be purged manually at the end of the month after activity checks have been conducted. Please give Isaac and Zooma a huge pat on the back for this as it simplifies everything and helps us big time with an easy and stable way to track hours that WE can configure to our liking. Excellent teamwork by you guys! I'm convinced there is nothing this team can't accomplish with our talent when we put our minds together! (There shouldn't be any major bugs, however as always let us know if something comes up. There is a chance that if your game crashes you may need to go back on duty and off duty to remove the on duty role. Also if your game crashes and your time is not logged, please let a Senior Admin+ know as they can add your time manually. The green check mark on the offduty embed signifies that the time was logged by the bot.) Thanks. (edited)
10
101 | Hyperion 11/19/2021 5:17 AM
- By the way, your time worked until today is still logged on the old bot and will be included along with what is left from the panel at the end of month. Then, with any luck we will consolidate to one system and be done.
101 | Hyperion 11/19/2021 5:40 AM
To check your time on the old bot you can do "--data" (edited)
101 | Hyperion 11/24/2021 2:55 AM
[ New Staff Guideline ] [ @SARP | Server Staff ] All, As of the time time of this announcement I am introducing a new staff guideline. This guideline pertains to the clocking of staff time while afk.
Now that our clockins are purely based on /staffduty staff who are caught afk and clocking time may be kicked from the server so that they do not continue to clock time while not actually staffing.
Here are the details, 1) Only Admin+ may kick ranks lower than themselves for being afk while staffing. Admins may not kick those equal to or higher than their rank. 2) If you need to step away from the computer for a moment that is understandable and you may do so but no longer than 10min, and ensure that you let others in staff RTO know this. You should also use the away message feature in TS to show you will be back in 10min. 3) If you fail to respond to pokes, pings or in RTO after 10min you may be kicked by an Administrator or above to stop accruing staff time. 4) This will not count as a disciplinary action unless it becomes continuous and there is a clear pattern of this occurring. 5) Head Administrators and above are exempt from this as they are not required to clock in game time. 6) If a Senior Administrator or Administrator is found to be afk while on as staff they are also subject to being kicked but ONLY by someone of a higher rank. Or a staff report may be submitted if there is no higher ranks on. This policy is to ensure staff remain active while on duty and are not falsely clocking time. This will have no effect on many of you as I know you are highly active however there have been several complaints lately regarding this issue. I will be contacting Admin+ regarding their directives involving this policy shortly in admin chat. The staff guidelines will be updated shortly. Thanks. (edited)

Just don't annoy the entire server with constant explosions. Thanks, I hope everyone has a wonderful holiday with their family and friends! Thanks.

101 | Hyperion 12/03/2021 9:03 PM
[ New Staff Conduct ] @SARP | Trial Moderator Over the last two days we've been hearing quite a few complaints about some of the new trial moderators which were just appointed to staff. It is quite clear some of you may need to re-read the staff guidelines or be retrained as some of the complaints are obvious violations. Please remember that becoming a staff member is difficult but it's even more difficult to remain a staff member as you are held to a very high standard and expected to educate yourself on guidelines as well as remain professional and mature at all times. To highlight some of the complaints: 1 - You are to speak with everyone before you kick/ban them, this includes giving them a chance to explain or respond. You may issue warnings without speaking to someone however you MUST explain the reason for the warning in the message box so they understand what NOT to do again. 2 - While actively staffing you may NOT create any priority or take part in any actions which constitute violent or criminal activity. You may NOT shoot at anyone in roleplay while staffing. 3 - You are NEVER to abuse your permissions as a staff member. This includes no clipping while in roleplay, freezing people without a legitimate reason or using any other permissions out side of what they are intended for. 4 - You are NOT to interfere with any on going roleplay scene unless you whatness a serious server rule violation or are called to the scene by a staff call. This means un-noclipping, speaking into your mic during a scene or anything else that interferes with the realism of the scene. I will give you an example, if you are observing a scene and someone self revives but the rest of the scene is still on going and you have not been called there. Try issuing a warning to the person who revived, advising them not to self revive. That way you do not interfere with the scene but you have warned someone of a roleplay violation. If they continue to commit violations you may need to step in. But start small, the goal is to not affect roleplay unless we have to. There are some scenes where people make mistakes but it works it's self out and staff are not needed. We don't want to blow up a scene and cancel it unless that is desired by those in the scene or unless it's something we just cant allow to continue. 5 - This is possibly the most important of all, listen to those above you... If you are a trial moderator, I don't care if you were a head admin somewhere else, you need to listen to those who have been staff HERE longer than you have. They know the small details that you may not have learned yet as things are different in every server. You would be wise to listen to moderators and senior moderators as they will be the ones to help you learn and grow. You are REQUIRED to listen to Administrators+ regardless. Teamwork is one of the most important things in staff, if you do not know how to work or get along with others to accomplish the mission, you better learn quick or there will not be a place for you here. Going forward any trial moderators who abuse permissions, violate staff guidelines or are acting in a manor which is not reflective of our standards of professionalism may be removed immediately. Mistakes may happen but immaturity and unprofessionalism will not be tolerated. Remember, you were chosen because be believed you had what it takes to be part of the staff team. Prove us right. Thanks. All Trial Moderators MUST acknowledge this announcement below using: (edited)

211 | Pach 12/05/2021 1:15 PM
[ Staff Applications] [ @SARP | Server Staff ] Good afternoon, Over the past few weeks I've seen a multitude of staff members commenting on staff applications incorrectly. As most of you know, Ozzy and Hyperion try their best when reviewing these applications and you're the advisors when giving "+1" or "-1" comments on these applications, which is why on the staff guidelines it states that you must provide at least 2 full sentences or 3 bullet point answers to justify your reasoning for a "+1", or a "-1". Which most of you, are not following. Staff Guideline
• Moderators and above are allowed to comment on member’s staff applications on the community forums. ∙ Staff members must provide 2 full sentences or 3 bullet point answers to justify their response. ∙ Failure to follow this guideline may see responses on applications deleted by Head Administrators or Management.
I cannot stress this enough than myself and the other Head Administrators already have, read the staff guidelines. It is of paramount importance that these guidelines are followed, as they are there for a reason. Thanks. (edited)

101 | Hyperion 12/06/2021 12:40 AM
[ Staff Applications Cont.. ] [ @SARP | Server Staff ] To expand on this, If you comment "plagiarism" or "copied staff application" I expect you reference where they copied the information from and explain the aligation. If not the comment will be removed. This goes for comments such as "not fit for staff", you need to state why, such as punishment history, lack of maturity etc.. Using server rules in your staff application is fine, as long as they use their own words as well. I just looked over an application that had a ton of effort put into only to see comments indicating "lack of effort". If these types of comments continue without merit or explanations I will restrict it to Senior Moderator+ Use common sense please. (edited)

Charlie S. 12/06/2021 11:15 AM
| 5,000 Member at San Andreas Roleplay! Good afternoon everyone, I hope we are all doing great! I am mind-blown to announce us hitting the mark of 5,000 Discord Members! This is absolutely amazing, for a Community to whom was doubted from our beginning, we have come some far way! A Thank You!
From the Management Team and I, this feat could have never been done without the dedication, comittment, and true hard-work that you ladies & gentlemen put in on a daily-basis, to keep this Community running, alive, and forever expanding to new horizons! Those old & new, I give you all a pat on the back, and a kiss on the cheek! I look forward to future; Meeting, and & working with everyone. Just please remember that no matter the number displayed at the top of this Discord, this Management Team will always stay loyal to our goal of providing the finest level of roleplay!
Regardless of the fact we were botted last night to 5,400 Member's, please ignore that, we had the same incident a few months back, to which the Accounts were later banned! So that can too be expected. Community Announcement later tonight! Again, Thank You! Signed, Community Management
San Andreas Roleplay - @SARP | Notified

101 | Hyperion 12/08/2021 11:55 PM
[ Moderation of Public Chats ] [ @SARP | Server Staff ] All, Some of you may know there was an incident in general chat tonight that involved retired staff members calling someone out in chat and causing drama to unfold from the subsequent topic. This spiraled completely out of control and resulted in a former staff member being banned and another muted. I'm going to put out a global announcement shortly to all discords addressing public chats within the main discord. Here's the short of it. No one, and I mean NO ONE is to call anyone out in a public chat. If you have an issue with someone, it must be taken to DMs. Nothing infuriates me more than seeing someone start an argument in publics chats, this is unprofessional and damn embarrassing. If you see anyone calling someone out, creating drama or arguing to the extent that it becomes heated or disrespectful you as a staff member MUST put a stop to it. Staff moderate the discord just as they do the gaming server and discord. I do not care if it's a pubcop, a retired staff member or department staff, if an argument breaks out STOP it immediately. Advise them to take it to DMs, if it continues MUTE them and if they hold a position of merit in the community please notify an Admin+. If someone in staff starts the argument or antagonizes it and makes it worse there will be sever consequences. Be responsible, reasonable and DO NOT let egos influence your thinking. Having said that, don't just mute for someone "razzing" or giving someone who they are friends with crap, make sure that it is a verified dispute. Side note: This applies to staff chat as well, do not call each other out, take it to DMs to discuss and resolve it like adults. (edited)

101 | Hyperion 12/10/2021 1:12 AM
[ Hyper's Holiday Gift to All ] [ @SARP | Server Staff ] All, I know this time of year can be stressful, the holidays are a wonder time of year but come with a lot of increased stress as well. I know many of you work your asses off to get your hours, others struggle with school, work and family. Others will be going out of town to see family and such. So for the month of December there will not be a 20 hour requirement for staff. I don't want you guys to stress over getting hours this month. However, we still need to staff the server, so please try and get on when you can especially during times of mid to high player counts. This does not mean you don't have to staff, it just means I will not be enforcing the hourly requirement for December. Keep in mind trial moderators still must work hours to prove themselves and move up, and hours will still be considered for any promotions. Again, we must still have staff in the server during the popular times and I don't want to see 100 pings for staff. Everyone still needs to pitch in to help. We will likely have a few trial moderator promotions this weekend and some bigger promos later this month! I hope this gives you guys a little breathing room this month and lets you enjoy the Holidays! Thanks! (edited)

101 | Hyperion 12/11/2021 2:41 AM
[ Anti-Raid ] All, Small update, I’m currently testing a bot feature that should monitor for any incoming bot raids. If more than 15 accounts join the discord in under 5 seconds which are under 1 month old it should both notify us and block further accounts matching the same criteria. It will also list the accounts and advise us when the raid is over. We shall see how well it works upon the next raid. You will notice #🔷・discord-anti-raid has been added and will be where the notifications will display. Thanks,

11
101 | Hyperion 12/12/2021 1:10 AM
[ Few Issues ] All, Two things that came up today.
1) Someone saying "allah akbar" alone is not blacklisted or terrorist roleplay. The term literally means "God is Great". However if they use the term in conjunction to killing/harming others then it would be considered terrorist roleplay.
2) Please remember that gang roleplay is defined as: 5.02.1 - A gang is defined as 3 or more members who claim to be apart of a group which commits crimes under a group name or matching and or similar clothing, as those too, are restricted to the Certified Civilian Department. Please make sure it's over 2 players before you kick someone for gang roleplay.
Thanks. (edited)

If they refuse kick, if they continue to cause issues then ban for CC Gang RP so that we know it was a CC gang they were rp'ing as and not just some jokers roleplaying as the Burrito Bandits or something. Members can roleplay, up to 2 members only, as a biker gang, just not Lost MC or any other CC gang. Thanks. (edited)

110 | ozzymon68 12/15/2021 2:16 AM
[Staff/Server related issues] There have been some issues recently within staff that need to be addressed. Those of use within Head Admins, management, and ownership have all had issues with other servers not listening to the complaints of staff or members of the server. Being told no to everything that we feel would best fit the server. We do not want these issues to begin here within this server. Everyone stated above is willing to hear your complaints and fit what would help best fit the server, or explain why something is the way it is. When these things are not addressed properly we end up with an excessive amount of drama that can be avoided by simply stating your complaints. We have only head complaints that people don't like how things are ran or how they don't like their rank. We cannot do anything when we simply do not know what your exact complaint is. Another topic that has been brought up is staff members flexing their rank(s) when not needed nor wanted. I have been known to do these things in the gesture of a joke, after this has been brought up I will say that I will not be doing this anymore. Those of you who know me well know that I will joke around a lot. Not all of you can easily make it known that you are joking, which causes people to think that you are just flexing your powers to show off. This cannot be happening anymore. If you are angry while staffing and cannot seem to calm down, leave the server. It does not matter if you are leaving the server without staff, if you're leaving a T-Mod alone, or even if you're leaving one staff member alone with 100 people. The angrier you are, the dumber and more poorly thought out your decisions are. Those of you who I have spoken to while you were angry while staffing, I have told you to leave server before I pull your roles. I do not say this as a way to "flex". I do this because I will not allow you to risk your position within staff because you are bound to make a dumb mistake. Lastly, this is not yelling at any of you. This is simply to inform you of your options and things that need to change on both ends of the staff team. This is also not an invitation to start reporting every staff member on the team for every little thing. Talk to people in a calm, respectful, manner. If they are not responding to you, then move to someone higher. If you're an Admin and a Moderator tells you an issue they have with you, just listen to them and have a civil conversation. You may not like everyone of the staff team, however you still need to be civil with everyone on the team. Make sure to read this in it's entirety, do not skim. We want to ensure that everyone has a good time. This is a video game, we do not need to deal with extra stress and anger because we cannot speak to each other. HA+ communication is important, however your communication is even more important as it gives us the ability to fix the things that need to be changed.

101 | Hyperion pinned a message to this channel. 12/15/2021 2:34 AM
101 | Hyperion 12/17/2021 11:25 PM
[ Staff Conduct ] [ @SARP | Server Staff ] All, I am seeing more and more unprofessional clips of some staff dealing with scenes. When you are dealing with people you are to ALWAYS be professional with members and ask their side of an issue. Use statements such as: - What are we doing? - Why are you/you guys doing this? - Please explain why you are doing this. - Why are we <insert rule violation>? This gives them the opportunity to respond and you the opportunity to evaluate them as a person and validate whether their actions were an honest mistake or intentional.
I do not want to see any more clips with staff saying. "Alright i'm fucking banning you" or "Your getting a ban, enjoy!"
You are better than that, this team is more professional than that. We all reach out limits when dealing with assholes and trolls, but remember not everyone is a troll and deserves to be treated professionally. Even trolls will try and clip staff acting unprofessional and then post them online. Don't let them bait you into an over reaction. Thanks. (edited)

21
101 | Hyperion 12/22/2021 12:44 AM
[ Important Update ] [ @SARP | Server Staff ] Security Breach, New Security Process All, Whether you were aware of it or not, we had a security breach with a member who claimed he was a staff member who's account had been hacked. He requested roles and was granted them due to the fact that he went to lengths to ensure the account looked identical. To avoid this in the future, staff who's account's become compromised whether it be from a direct action from discord or from a malicious link must now submit a Staff Verification Request via their already verified account on the forums.
If hacked, staff are to go to: https://sanandreasroleplay.net/forums/staff-team-account-verification.42/ using your forums account, complete the form. Once it is submitted only Head Administrators can process a verification request. Please note that only staff members on the forums can even see this part of the forums so there should be no risk of fraudulent verification requests.
No staff members are to request discord roles re-assigned in the role request channel. Also, no SA+ is to ever re-assign roles to anyone making a request in the channel for staff roles. Thanks. (edited)

102 | Alex M. 12/26/2021 10:43 PM
[Management Disciplinary Incident] Date Taken Place: 12/22/21
On the evening of 12/22/21 Management Member Casey K. confronted a member of the gaming server who was thought to be impersonating a member of another community and publicly announced the individuals ip address in the presence of other players. This individual then posted both Casey’s and the Server’s information on a well known, public DOX site which endangered both himself and the community.
This action not only violates our trust in management but also tarnishes the core of what this community believes in and how we operate. @308 | Grandpa KC 🚔 , your actions degraded the trust members may have in management and jeopardized our reputation as a community. We believe your actions to be of poor judgment and without forethought of how it would affect our community as a whole.
Because of this, the Ownership team has jointly chosen to impose a two week suspension of duties, permissions and privileges effective immediately. For transparency, this announcement is made for the good of the staff team & community. This incident will be considered a “strike” on your record.
Something I want to make clear is all IP logs will now be restricted to Ownership members only, which will prevent an issue from this happening again. Since we are human, mistakes will always be made; we all hope the lesson learned by this disciplinary action ensures better judgment is used in the future and we see no repeat incidents as it relates to your judgment and decision making within the community. This incident is now closed and is no longer to be further disputed outside of the staff team.
Signed, SARP Ownership @SARP | Server Staff (edited)

Charlie S. 01/01/2022 10:06 AM
| San Andreas Roleplay - Management Inductions Good afternoon from here in the United Kingdom, I hope we are all having a marvellous Weekend, with awesome New Year's celebrations taking place! Over the last few weeks & months, there has been a huge amount of discussion & debate going on inside the Management & Ownership Teams, regarding the expansion of our Management Team, and it's fair to say, we're delighted to have come to a final decision! I wish to give a very warm welcome to our TWO New San Andreas Roleplay Community Management Members!
➤ Head Administrator Pach or Julian G. --> Department Liason ➤ Head Administrator Ozzymon --> In-Game Coordinator
These two individuals hard-work over the last Year & since the very start, has been unmatched; Their work towards their Departments, General Server Operations, and everything else, has been so greatly appreciated! They deserve this opportunity like nothing else, and I wish them the best, I know they will proudly serve our Community! You may be asking, what their Job Title enroles as they move into the Management Team. I ask that everyone reads below in regards to what you may expect from Pach & Ozzy. Department Liaison - Job Description:
➤ The Department Liaison acts as a point of contact for the server's public safety departments. This position is responsible for building and maintaining mutually beneficial relationships among the public safety command staff to better facilitate good communications. ➤ This position also reviews department fleet requests, EUP and may assist any department in its daily operations when called upon to do so. The Department Liaison will also hold the responsibility of managing CAD warrant, BOLO and other record removal requests.
In-Game Coordinator - Job Description:
➤ The In-Game Coordinator is responsible for the overall quality of roleplay within the San Andreas Roleplay game server. This position ensures all in-game rules, guidelines and policies are being followed by all members during gameplay. The In-Game Coordinator may also work with the Ownership Team to address or suggest any changes to Server Rules or Guidelines. This position also acts as a point of contact for the server’s Certified Civilian Operations and will work with their command staff to ensure the best quality roleplay. Other duties include coordinating and planning server events.
Pach & Ozzy's Departments
➤ It goes without being said that both Pach & Ozzy are Department Heads of the Blaine County Sheriff's Office & Certified Civilian Operation, respectively. Coming hand-in-hand with Management, unfortunately, this run will have to come to an end. However, I'll stop you there! ➤ These individuals will be given the opportunity of significant time & resources to best determine the best fit candidate for the position. There is neither a deadline, nor pressure for the new selection, however, it’s expected the selection to be preferential to the continued succession of the Department.
Anyway! Please help me in congratulating these two individuals in #💬・staff-chat! These two have worked tirelessly on behalf of the Community, so they deserve it! Thank You! I believe Hyperion may have something special coming up too?! Stay Tuned. Thank You! P.s. This is to remain Internal in the Staff Team, til a Server Wide Announcement in 30-45 Minutes Signed, Community Management
San Andreas Roleplay - @SARP | Server Staff

[ Staff Meeting ] [ @SARP | Server Staff ] All, We will hold a staff meeting to address any questions or concerns tonight at 8pm EST. Following this announcement there will be an attendance sheet, please react if you will be attending. Also, you may submit talking points using the form in #deleted-channel or simply ask during the open floor portion of the meeting. Thanks,

115 | Isaac Z. 01/06/2022 6:50 PM
[ Staff Suspension ] All, In the interest of transparency, @Deleted User has been placed on a 3 day Administrative Leave for breach of staff guidelines:
16) No Staff Team Member shall execute permissions onto another Staff Team Member. This includes freezing, slapping, kicking, teleporting to or from etc. Senior‌ ‌Administrators Duties) A). ‌May correct staff caught breaking guidelines (Reports this to Head Admin) B). May send lower ranking staff off duty and take roles pending disciplinary action.
To expand further, and for clarification, if you observe a staff member that you believe is breaking guidelines, please take it up with an SA+ and allow them to handle it. No one should be kicking anyone on the staff team for anything, except for very few circumstances (IE. perms reset if needed, being AFK for >10 mins per guidelines). To be absolutely clear, there was some confusion experienced that dulled the severity of this incident, and had this been straight up, an incident like this would have resulted in demotion. Thanks. 15
Charlie S. 01/06/2022 7:11 PM
| San Andreas Roleplay - Dedicated Server Update Good evening Staff Team, hope all is well & you're having a fine Thursday! As I am sure you're aware, our previous Dedicated Server was subject & open to a number of DoS based attacks, to which would severely hurt the uptime of our Game Server, this past December & even Summer. In response, to benefit the health of the Community, Management & I, have made the executive decision to change our System Host & System itself. Similiarly to our last host, we have obtained a Dedicated Server, however, this time, a hell of a lot faster! In effort of transparency, you can read the specs below, in comparison to our prior system: Dedicated Server 2022
➤ Hosting Provider - https://www.ovhcloud.com - OVH is one of the many trusted Platforms utilised by FiveM Community's, due to its top of the line Malicious Attack Protection. Feel free to read into the services they offer for our Community & how this will further protect us from these attacks.
➤ Server Location - Vint Hill, Virginia, United States of America ➤ Central Processing Unit - Ryzen 5 3600 --> Ryzen 7 3800X ➤ RAM - 32 GB --> 64 GB @ 2666 MHz
This new system is all that we shall ever need & more. The Server's key functions & configurations have already been professionally migrated & the Forums is already up & running on the new System! However, next comes the Game Server. This should be completed in the next 24-Hours. The Development Team are being briefed on proceedings as we speak! We are also working tirelessly to protect our Server Even more, by establishing a reverse proxy on our IP Address, via FiveM's built-in protocols. This is all in effort of protecting our Community, for continued growth throughout the Year & I believe there isn't a better way to start 2022, for us here at San Andreas Roleplay. Hope you enjoy! I'll keep you posted over the coming days. Cheers Signed, Community Management
San Andreas Roleplay - @SARP | Server Staff

101 | Hyperion 01/06/2022 10:26 PM
[ Kill Logs ] [ @SARP | Server Staff ] All, Thanks to @115 | Isaac Z.'s persistence and @Zooma's ingenuity we now have kill logs. When you get a chance please look over #deleted-channel and see how it works. This will benefit us in several ways, one of which is those who kill during peacetime. It will also help with people accused of VDM/RDM, you can check the log to see if someone was in fact killed by someone else. However this will not confirm the intent of RDM/VDM. However you can ask that person why they killed the member, if they say they did not kill anyone obviously that would be lying to staff. Clips are as always still desired if available. Be careful with VDM as there is always the chance of desync coming into play. As with any log, use it to help you make a decision but discuss it with the accused first to rule out any glitch or miscommunication. Thanks! (edited)
9
101 | Hyperion 01/07/2022 5:10 PM
[ New Trial Moderators ] [ @SARP | Trial Moderator ] This is specifically for the new trial moderators, Firstly, congratulations on becoming part of the team. You were selected because we believe that you posses the characteristics that we look for in new staff members. The most important things we look for are maturity, dedication, honesty and professionalism. If you are reading this announcement we believe you may posses those characteristics and could do well in the team. Become a staff member is difficult, but remaining a staff member can be even more challenging. Everything you do in the server is a direct reflection of you and the staff team. From this point on please ensure that you use good judgement and professionalism when dealing with members and when conducting your own roleplay. As a trial moderator you are being observed and tested to see if you have the desired traits to remain in the team. Remember that staffing is not about power, influence or privilege. In fact it's the exact opposite, being in staff is about helping members, dedicating yourself to the community and enforcing server rules when needed. Staffing is hard at times, it takes dedication and time along with a lot of self control and professionalism when dealing with people who are some times doing things to try and piss you off. If you ever get to the point of loosing your cool, stop and ask someone else to come help with the scene. Never treat anyone in a way you would not want to be treated. You can enforce the rules without being rude or angry. It does however take time to learn the ins and outs so rely on your senior staff members for help and guidance. Most issues I see with new staff could be resolved by reading and remembering the #deleted-channel. Please take the time the read them, then read them again. Lastly, please ensure you go over #deleted-channel and keep it up while staffing so you know your limits when it comes to imposing or requesting bans. I hope all of you do well, staffing can be fun as well and you will become close with your fellow staff members as you move up and progress in the team. Congratulations!
101 | Hyperion pinned a message to this channel. 01/07/2022 5:10 PM
101 | Hyperion 01/08/2022 12:09 AM
[ Staff Team Leadership 2022 ] [ @SARP | Server Staff ] All, I am very pleased to announce the following promotions, one of which is a position we have not been able to fill until this point! Please give these guys a big round of applause for the time and effort it took to reach these positions! SARP | Staff Team Director
- @115 | Isaac Z. The position of staff team director has never been filled up to this point. One, if not the most important requirement is that the director may not be a department head over another department. This position is solely dedicated to overseeing the daily operation of the staff team and lead the team of Head Administrators. Isaac has a long history in roleplay and in leadership positions, he has been an active, fair, level headed and dedicated Head Administrator for several months now and I am confident he is the man for the job! Please give him a huge congratulations in #💬・staff-chat! Isaac and I will be working closely over the coming weeks and months to ensure that the team continues to grow and be an example to the community!
SARP | Head Administrators Reporting to the Staff Director are the the Head Administrators. These guys are the brains of the team, they take on the most responsibility and ensure their sections/assignments are operating in the most professional way possible. This group of guys have earned their way into being called some of the best we have by their dedication, leadership and knowledge! The following are your new Head Administrator's and their assignments:
➤ Head of Staff Recruitment : @109 | Tokyo - Reviews staff applications weekly for any top candidates. - Accepts/Denies based on application, background and reviews. - Assigns proper roles in the discord for those accepted. - Ensures a swift timeline from acceptance to training complete. - Notifies the Senior Admins when new staff have been accepted. - Updates the Staff Roster with new candidates information. - Host open interviews if approved by management. ➤ Head of Staff Personnel: @218 | Neptune - Responsible for the overall upkeep of all staff documents. - Responsible for updating and maintain the staff roster. - Responsible for reviewing and updating all LOA's. - Responsible for reviewing staff activity at the end of the month. - Issues activity notices at the end of the month for inactivity. - Responsible for ensuring staff roles are set correctly. - Works with the Staff Director to ensure guidelines are up to date ➤ Head of Staff Investigations: @181 | Alex 🚑 - Responsible for overseeing staff investigations and ban appeals. - Reviews staff tickets daily to ensure they are being addressed. - Reviews staff investigators to ensure they are being professional. - Reviews appeal applications and ensures they are being handled. - Helps to train new staff investigators and ban appeal members. - Reviews accepted ban appeals to ensure they are within policy
I'm very excited moving forward with this group and hope to see the team continue to grow along with the server. Thanks, Hyper (edited)

[ EasyAdmin Bans ] [ @SARP | Server Staff We are aware of the issues with easyadmin bans not "sticking". Sometimes it takes 3 tries, and then they may still return. If you have someone whom you can not ban please ping management or ownership for a ban through TXAdmin, we do not have to be in game to ban someone, however the person you want banned needs to as it makes it easier. We will be working on a resolution over the next few hours and hope it to be resolved by morning. We will need their name and player ID Also, since the ban issue is on our end, please state the original reason for the ban as they are not really ban evading now that we know we have an issue. Thanks. (edited)

101 | Hyperion 01/13/2022 3:58 AM
[ EasyAdmin Update ] [ @SARP | Server Staff ] All, Much thanks to @Zooma, the issue with easyadmin was identified to be a problem with EA not writing new bans to the file. After some trial and error the issue has been resolved and bans should work fine now. Also, with this update the default easyadmin call notifications for staff are working again. They will show up for on and off duty staff, if you see a lot of calls that is an indication to you that staff may need a hand. This also means we should be able to try the new ingame call claiming option in the next day or so. More to come on that once it has been enabled. Lastly, with the new EA update you can now do custom ban lengths. I'm fine with you guys setting customs as long as you DO NOT go over the max amount specified for each offence in #deleted-channel. Thanks! (edited)

101 | Hyperion 01/14/2022 4:35 AM
[ In game CallAdmin Claiming ] [ @SARP | Server Staff ] All, In game calladmin call claiming is now active. This means that when a call comes in, you will see the notification, and instead of having to go into the discord to react to the call you will simply do the following: Open EasyAdmin -> Player Management -> Report Viewer Once you see the list of open calls please click on the one you wish to claim, if it has already been claimed by another staff member it will say the staff member who claimed it. Once you click claim it will be assigned to you, then you may click the reporting party and select what you wish to do, i.e. TP, Freeze etc.. Once the call has been handled you MUST then close the call to remove it from the list. We will evaluate this for the next week and see if we prefer this method. Admin+ You guys are tasked with ensuring these calls are both handled, claimed and closed properly. If calls start to stack up and staff are not closing them we will know who claimed it and need to address this with them. (For the next week as we evaluate this you do not have to react to calls in #🔰・staff-calls as you will be claiming them in game) Let me know what you guys think. Thanks. Hyper (edited)

101 | Hyperion 01/27/2022 4:28 PM
[ Staff Update ] All, Just wanted to give a little up date on things to keep everyone in the loop. - We will be bringing in another round of trial moderators either today or tomorrow. @SARP | Senior Administrator / @SARP | Administrator be on standby for interviews and trainings please. - Since we've been up and running on our new host I'm happy to say we have not been knocked off once. That's not to say someone with enough funds and know how wont be able to in the future but this should take care of the idiots who have limited knowledge and abilities to effect us. I believe Charlie said a week ago that we had recorded 2 DDOS attempts that failed to take us down so happy about that! Cheers to progress! - Our numbers continue to grow daily in the discord, however due to school and other factors I believe growth will be a bit slower until spring break and summer. - Everything we do now, over the next few months is to prepare us, the discord and server for the large growth i'm confident we will see during the summer. During Christmas break we saw an over 1k member ship spike and i'm confident we will surpass 10k this summer. - We have been working on the discords to ensure they are secure and will be able to handle the growth coming our way. I'm constantly looking at tweaking automod and other features to prevent trolling which will increase with more members. - I'm hoping to increase the size of both staff and support by the time summer hits so if you know someone who may be interested in joining either please urge them to apply. - As far as staff issues go, we've had several suspensions here lately. I nor any of the leadership in staff like to suspend anyone, however we must maintain a hard line on guidelines and expect a high level professionalism from our team. Please remember staffing means to both help and discipline members in server who break server rules. There's an old saying, "To a hammer, everything's a nail" Don't be a hammer, not everyone is a nail, aka not everyone is a troll. Use common sense and maturity and you will do just fine! - Staff activity will be checked in 4 days. Those of you who went on LOA this last week will not be saved from the activity check if you did not have at least some respectable numbers during the first 2-3 weeks of the month. - More promotions will come as we move more tmods/mods up. Hang in there, give your best effort and everyone will be given a chance to move up eventually. Remember, staff promotions are not like department promotions. We promote "As needed" as the team grows so does the need for more slots/promos. Thank you all for the time, effort and dedication you show the community! Hyper. (edited)

101 | Hyperion 02/05/2022 10:26 PM
[ Staff Team Activity ] [ @SARP | Server Staff ] Team, I wanted to make an announcement regarding a policy change to the current monthly requirement as it relates to staff hours and discuss a few things. As most of you know, I've been wanting to lower the staff hours a bit to give you guys some stress relief when it comes to balancing your department requirements and staff hours. I've been planning on doing this once the team was a bit larger. However, there are a few things in the works that may help you guys in the future and with some of you struggling right now I am willing to meet in the middle on this. Effective immediately, we will lower the monthly requirement to 15hrs a month from 20. This means apx 4hrs a week instead of 5. Those of you who were feeling a bit overwhelmed should get a little relief. However, to KEEP this lowered average, EVERYONE on the team needs to pitch in and contribute. I noticed in last months hours 4-5 people were harboring the load when it comes to staffing. While we appreciate those who work many many extra hours, they will get burned out quickly if their fellow teammates do not step up and assist with coverage. We will be monitoring this change over the next few weeks, if it becomes an issue and we start to see staff pings during the busy hours of the day we may have no choice but to return to the higher hourly requirement. Without saying too much, there are other things in the works that will help you guys have more room to manage your hours and that will become clear in the next few weeks. We are lucky right that over night NA times are still very light on the server with generally between 6-12 players on between 1am-6am EST. This allows you guys to get some rest and not have to cover the server 24/7. With that said the weekends still need to be covered late into the night and we have several night owls who have been help with that lately. As we grow I would love to have more NA and EU staff to help with those time frames. When it comes to those over night times, like I have said before, I do not expect you guys to stay up all night and staff the server for such a small player base. If you need to sleep, and there is only a small group on the server, go to bed! If you are the last staff member on and player count is low, simply type a note in staff chat (no ping needed) saying you are heading off, and that peace time is on. Venom will take care of most of the big issues from there. Thank you guys for your continued dedication, we will likely start looking at a few admin promos in the coming weeks. If you are a new Senior Moderator and want to be considered, submit a letter of interest and we will contact you when it comes time for the admin exam. Staff complaints from members are down considerably this last week, that is excellent! Keep being professional, helpful and represent the server like pros!! Staff meeting likely in the next week or so. Thanks, Hyper
