181 | Alex 🚑 07/26/2022 10:21 PM
[ Handling Of Staff Sits/Controlling Emotions ] [ @SARP | Server Staff ] Based on events that have occurred yesterday and what I personally saw in server last night, I figured I should address an issue. So far, we have been doing great handling situations on staff sits and helping create better RP. However, after the chaos that ensued last night, some staff members I think let their emotions get the best of them. I have seen an uptick in reports of staff members not hearing all sides of a story, stalking members to see if their breaking rules, and some short fuse conversations. Like we have said before, people like to join the server and get under your skin to see how you react. We need to try our best and control how we react to members in server and keep our calm demeanor. Letting your emotions get the best of you can lead to punishable consequences and regrettable actions. If you find yourself getting increasingly agitated, please take some time away from staff duty to cool off. It's better to step away and cool off then get agitated with server members in game. Keeping your professional attitude is key to upkeeping the look you have on the server as you become the spotlight and sometimes some people's first interaction in server. If you take away anything from this announcement, keep a control on your emotions and be respectful to members no matter how they react to you. It's one of those "use your customer service voice" when handling members in server as staff. It's been found that if you stay calm and don't raise your voice, the other person yelling will feel awkward and lower their tone. [you don't have to take absolute disrespect but don't take it to heart] Thanks for your time. Signed, Head Of Staff Investigations - @181 | Alex 🚑

151 | Matt 07/28/2022 2:55 PM
[Uptick in Staff Reports] [ @SARP | Server Staff ] All, Recently me alongside the Head Administrator's have seen a huge increase in staff reports being opened on members of the staff team. Now, I won't say that all of these are accurate and deemed valid, but some of them do raise a few valid points here and there. Please remember that when you are staffing, to always show professionalism. If someone is clearly trolling and trying to catch you off guard so that you slip up, so then they can open a report, learn to move on from them. Handle the situation, inform them of any/such punishment being administered, and leave the scene. There has been a few instances where staff members just go back and forth with the member trolling, and that needs to stop. This is what they want, they want YOU to go back with them, they love to see your energy being set forth on them, so that they can troll more. They are demanding of your energy, and they will keep doing it until you slip up and accidentally say something wrong so they can report you. Administer the punishment, and leave the scene. Simple. Also, there was a few incidents of members not putting the correct ban message in the section within EasyAdmin. Please only put what #deleted-channel has for the punishment, don't add too much else. Be professional and mature at all times, don't put anything that will jeopardize your position within the team. And also, if the member says a blacklisted word, don't put the word in the ban message, that will just cause havoc within server and it will cause "false alarms" within Administrator+ Chat... Thank you all, and keep up the good work. Clock-ins reset in a couple days, so be sure to check your activity. Regards, Matt H. | Head Administrator Head of Staff Personnel

We've decided on this action instead of a demotion or termination due to him coming forth and admitting his mistake which mad him feel remorse. Myself and the rest of the leadership team are far more likely to take into consideration the circumstances and accept everyone makes mistakes if you are honest with us. If we found out ourselves, he likely would have faced termination and a blacklist. Please be professional, please be honest and uphold the teams values. We make exceptions to the age requirement for a reason if someone's application is good enough to prevent mistakes like this. 115 | Isaac Z. 08/13/2022 10:46 PM
[Maturity And Professionalism] [@SARP | Server Staff] All, I'm going to make something very clear, and any member of this team who cannot understand or fails to abide by these standards WILL be removed. Just as our regular members don't get to complain about their kicks and bans in our chats, so is the same for complaining about the outcome of a decision in this community as a department member. When I say this I do not mean negative feedback, I mean whining and moaning or getting an attitude with members involved in that decision. If you aren't mature enough to handle yourself without causing a scene, I don't want you on this team, plain and simple. This also applies to any disciplinary actions made against you in any department, or if you didn't like promotions. When you signed up to serve this community regardless of department (but especially as staff), you agreed you would be mature and professional, and represent our community standards. Acting like a 4 year old who didn't get their way, arguing with higher-ups, and holding an attitude/grudge against them is not representative of our standards, or mature and professional in any way. When I said I don't want people who do the above things on this team, this also includes performing these actions while hiding behind a private chat and slandering supervisors or members over something that occurred in the community. I don't mind you express a dislike or have negative feedback in the appropriate community areas or a private chat, but utilizing slander (slurs/extremely derogatory statements), will see yourself being held liable for misconduct. Please react with ✅ if you understand this and know you can handle yourself in a mature and professional manner. Staff Team Coordinator Isaac Z. (edited)

101 | Hyperion 08/14/2022 8:17 PM
[ Interfering with scenes & freezing known members ] [ @SARP | Server Staff ] All, Recently there was a scene that seemed to cause quite a bit of confusion and wasted a lot of folk's time. The basis of this scene was that known members of the server departments were frozen for nearly 10min while it was discussed whether or not they interfered with a scene. However, they themselves started the scene. I bring this up to say this, as staff, unless you are watching a scene from the very beginning, it is nearly impossible for you to know if someone is interfering with it or were originally part of it. The best and desired course of action would be to simply wait until someone calls admin for someone interfering as the ones involved in the scene are the only ones who truly know who is and is not interfering. Your other option is to simply noclip/spectate and listen for someone accusing another of interfering. Otherwise you generally can not make the call on your own, as you are not involved in the roleplay and do not know the specifics of the scene. The other issue here, known members of the server, especially those in department staff or command should not need to be frozen in the game. There is little to no risk of these people "running off" or acting a fool on a staff sit to where you would need to freeze them. Simply TP to them and speak to them. Freezing should be reserved for trolls or unknown members who are likely to run around like fools and you would like to keep them still for a bit. If you do get a member of department staff+ acting a fool, please report that to Pach immediately. (Tokyo currently covering for Pach while he is out of state) The biggest key to staffing is simply use common sense guys, we try to solve problems, not stop scenes and create problems with little to no evidence or 3rd hand information. Thanks, Hyper

181 | Alex 🚑 08/19/2022 7:41 PM
[ Checking In To Staff RTO ] [ @SARP | Server Staff ] Hello all. Like discussed and stated explicitly in our staff guidelines, you are REQUIRED to check in to staff RTO before doing other things in server. That's the entire reason you are automatically moved to Staff RTO unless a SA+. Before requesting to go on as a department or civ, at least check the volume of staff calls, player count, how many LEO are on, and how many staff are currently on. I'm tired of seeing staff members stuck on duty for 4-5 hours and no one offering to help while in game. If someone has been staffing for 3 hours and you just got there, do NOT immediately ask to go on as a department. Ask those there longer if they would like to go, then you may go if they do not. If I continue to see this, punishment will start being handed out. I don't care if you have the hours for the month or not, nowhere in staff guidelines does it state "once you get your hours for the month, you don't have to staff for the rest of the month". When you joined the staff team you were asked in your interview if you agreed to the statement at the end that stated explicitly "[you understand] that server care is over RP". Upon agreement, you were a part of the staff team. You were also asked about integrity, teamwork, and dedication as well. You need to start showing it or your time here could come to an end. * I hate to come off as rash or rude, but other members of this team are feeling disgruntled with always being on staff duty. I understand department hours are important but you applied and volunteered to be on the staff team. Utilizing proper time management and planning will help in getting department hours as well as being a great life skill. Remember, *no matter how corny it sounds, teamwork makes the dream work! Thanks for your time! Signed, Alex R. | Head Administrator Head Of Staff Investigations

Charlie S. 09/08/2022 5:03 PM
[ My Personal Situation Changes ] [ @SARP | Server Staff ] A very good evening here from a very sorrowing United Kingdom. Seeing our longest ever serving Monarch, pass away this evening was the horrible outcome of a short-illness; Yet, shall for decades, provide not only our Nation, but the World, a lifetime of memories and commemoration of her service & vast accomplishments. Rest in Peace. Despite of such tragic news, I would like to take your attention for a slight moment, and update you on my Personal time Situation, with my new, updated work Schedule, and how I plan to fit such Work around the Community! As of Monday, I had started my new Job. As, popular to contrary belief on every level, Community Ownership is not the life many would see that of an Instragram Crypto Trader showcase As a result of this, the time that many of you and I possessed during the Summer, has quickly been stripped away! Whether you guys are at school, or tied up with anything else, it can be hard, and I have completely come to understand that! I just want to let you guys know that I am still here, and will continue to spend as much free-time, as possible, whilst still balancing my other Hobbies too! I understand many of you are in the same position as me, so in no way am I trying undermine anyone's schedules, at all; Simply, I am just letting you lovely ladies & gents know of my own reduced presence in & around the Community, in the case that you are all thinking, "Where the fuck has Charlie been!!" Thank you for your time! I hope to speak to you all soon! And again, Rest in Peace.

101 | Hyperion 09/10/2022 12:22 AM
[ EasyAdmin Issues - Possibility Resolved. ] All, Those of you who are having issues with EasyAdmin, we have determined that using the beta build of FiveM seems to be causing the issue. If you are on the beta, switch back to the release build to resolve the issue. Thanks, Hyper [ @SARP | Server Staff ] (edited)

101 | Hyperion 09/16/2022 11:57 PM
[ Forums Channels ] [ @SARP | Server Staff ] All, Forums channels were enabled for us this evening, as I posted some time back my hope is that this new feature will allow us to both condense and better organize the discord. Currently I'm starting with the staff section for testing purposes to ensure this works as planned. My biggest concern is that the posts inside the forums channels may archive at some point, if that's the case this may not work as intended. However over the past few hours after playing with it, it does appear that they do not archive as threads do. So far I've moved a large portion of the staff section into three categories which contain all of the original channels to which they replaced. They are: #📋・staff-information (View Only) - General Information - Staff Guidelines - Banning Guidelines - Staff Commands - Basic CC Guidelines for RP #📮・staff-requests (View/Comment) - LOA Center - Staff Suggestions - Staff Questions - Roster Update Requests #deleted-channel (View/Comment) - Evidence Drop - In Game Ban Requests - Discord Ban Requests - Unban Requests Now, you can click on any post and follow it so that it remains displayed on your screen and you receive updates. This may be helpful to those who have to monitor some posts such as LOA center, unban requests etc.. Otherwise you can simply unfollow the post so that it hides it in the forums channel and does not show it individually in the discord channel list which helps condense everything. You can also right click the options on each post to make it open in full screen or half screen, which ever you prefer. I can not condense all the staff chat channels as there is no "individual" role permissions for each post within the forums channel so basically each forums post channel is either open to all or closed to all same with posting vs not permitted to post. If you notice any issues please let me know. This will continue to be a work in progress. Thanks, Hyper
151 | Matt 09/17/2022 8:49 PM
[Chain of Command - Contact] [ @SARP | Server Staff ] All, Please, when you plan on resigning, retiring, etc, come to ME, or another Head Administrator if I do not respond within a few hours of your request. I do not need anyone else messaging Management+ for these things, when us Head Administrators run the Staff Team with Isaac overseeing us. Any further contact to Management without proper permission will be met with punishment. Thank you. Signed, Matt H. | Head Administrator Head of Staff Personnel (edited)

101 | Hyperion 09/18/2022 1:42 AM
[ #💬・discussion ] Related to the above new section just announced in #📢・announcements. Please ensure you are checking/monitoring the new public forum channel for any shenanigans. I have confirmed that the discord automod feature does regulate the forums channels as well so there should be limited issues with trolling. However, there's always the chance someone posts about a less than desirable topic. While I hope over time this will up our member engagement a bit, I do not want it to become a drama fest. Please ensure no one is trying to flame someone or posting about political, religious or other commonly controversial topics. If it's something that's borderline, let it go for a few and see how the conversation goes. Otherwise fell free to report the post. Any posts related to support, staff or bans etc.. should be removed and the member should be directed to #🪧・support-center or #📩・staff-reports. When they make a new post they must pick a relevant topic so I'm hoping that will give them the hint that it's not the proper place. But I know I'm asking too much. Currently, Senior Administrator+ can manually remove posts or comments. Those of you who have purge/mute will still have access to those commands as well. Also, I have removed all of the RP channels as they were not being used at all and took up a bit of space for something not being utilized. Thanks, Hyper (edited)
1
101 | Hyperion 09/19/2022 1:43 PM
[ Few Updates ] Please note that the following channels are now open to posting. #🛑・server-issues (Staff members, please post any issues or bugs you find in the server here and not in bug reports. We can verify issues posted here a bit quicker than the general bug reports.) #📮・staff-requests (Staff should post and tag all requests here, such as ban requests, unban requests, LOA requests and roster updates. SA+ will then follow up their actions with tagging the post completed/approved. #❓・staff-questions (Staff should post all questions with the appropriate tags) The only new channel that is not open to posting, and will remain view only is #📋・staff-information which is simply being used as a file cabnet to hold documents and information instead of using 7 additional channels. Thanks, Hyper

[Gang RP/Priority 22's] So it has come to my attention that staff members are 22ing priorities just because there is over 3 people involved. This shouldn't be the sole reason to stop roleplay! I don't care if there are 10 people in this priority so long as they are not wearing gang colors, driving gang cars, or calling themselves any of the 500 different ways to say "gang". You should only intervene if acts of FRP, RDM, VDM, or trolling is present. Stop breaking up and interrupting RP over petty issues like breaking character or "too many people". This is all for now. Signed, Alex R. | Head Admin Head Of Staff Investigations

218 | Neptune 09/26/2022 7:13 PM
Re-introducing Staff of the Month Hello ladies and gentlemen, if you didn't attend the staff meeting Saturday you likely missed the information regarding the return of Staff of the Month. With that in mind, this announcement will explain the current blueprint for the returning recognition program. If you have any questions still after reading the announcement, feel free to @ me in staff chat and I'll respond when available. Basic Outline Starting October 1st, you guys will be competing amongst your peers for Staff of the Month. Unlike in the past, this new system will allow up to four (4) different individuals to obtain Staff of the Month along with the rewards that come with. The way this works is based on your rank and the rewards follow a tiered reward system based on the position you hold. Simply put if you are a Moderator, you will only be competing with other Moderators for the Moderator reward and the same goes for Senior Moderator, Administrator and Senior Administrator. Trial Moderators and Head Administrator + are not in the running for any reward due to the lack of time served for most T-Mods and the fact HA + don't need incentives. Voting System The candidates who meet the eligibility requirements for the month of October will be eligible for the vote, the vote will be conducted by the Head Administration Team on October 30th and announced on November 1st. Votes will always take place two (2) days prior to the announcement and announcements will always land on the 1st of every month. Reward System Diamond VIP - Will be rewarded to the top Senior Administrator & Administrator of the month. Gold VIP - Will be rewarded to the top Senior Moderator of the month. Silver VIP - Will be rewarded to the top Moderator of the month. If you already have the VIP tier you are rewarded with, there are other possible rewards that will be at the discretion of Ownership. Possible rewards include store vouchers, VIP tier for a month or others and will be issued on a case by case basis from Ownership. Eligibility Requirements - Subject to Change - Senior Administrator 1. Must hit twenty (20) hours for the month. 2. Must complete at least five (5) task (Staff Interview, Staff Training, Staff Investigation, Ban Appeal) - Administrator 1. Must hit twenty (20) hours for the month. 2. Must complete at least three (3) task (Staff Training, Ban Appeal) - Senior Moderator 1. Must hit twenty (20) hours for the month. - Moderator 1. Must hit twenty (20) hours for the month. Please react with a ✅ once you've read this announcement and acknowledge it. Signed, Head Administrator - Neptune @SARP | Community Ownership @SARP | Community Management @SARP | Server Staff

115 | Isaac Z. 09/27/2022 6:57 PM
[First New AOP] [ @SARP | Server Staff ] All, First new AOP is in: North Los Santos, everything north of Del Perro FW, stopping midway up the hills. Due to limitations with FiveM the map outline of AOP is a little jank, but it's the best that can be done for anything more complex than a square or circle. Only these new custom AOP's will have the map border, and the border sadly cannot be shown on the minimap without annoyances due to another FiveM limitation. Signed, Isaac (edited)

101 | Hyperion 09/28/2022 12:50 PM
[ Tokyo S. Retirement, Management ] [ @SARP | Server Staff ] All, Please join me in congratulating our friend and colleague @109 | Tokyo on a much earned retirement. This is bitter sweet to most of us as Tokyo has come to be a trusted and capable member of management as well as am outstanding friend to all. Tokyo's skill set as it relates to people, leadership and organization has been a true blessing to both the management team and the community. Tokyo has been a major player in many parts of our community, from department command in SAHP, BCSO, SAFR and assisting in SASP. Tokyo has also maintained oversight of our Support Team along with assisting with development projects from time to time. Tokyo's biggest draw as a management member will always be his willingness to listen to others, consider their opinions and always respecting those serving under him. I would like to join with all of the SARP Community Management and Ownership in thanking him for his steady hand in the leadership of this community and wish him much luck and success in whatever he may do next. Please congratulate him on a much earned retirement in #💬・staff-chat, an announcement will be made to the community as a whole within the next 20min. Tokyo will remain in and around the community as a member of any department so you may well see him around from time to time.
PS: If you are available, join Tokyo's Office for a short little thank you and farewell party. His office is currently open to all staff and support members! Come wish him well!!!!
Thanks, Hyperion (edited)

Thanks guys. I'm writing this on the spot so bear with me lol I'll keep it short. The last year has been only what I can describe as a dream. Working my way up from the bottom and finnaly making it to the top within my career, I've learned so much along the way and met people that I cherish very much. Learning what it means to be a leader upon working with those that have seen me through will be something that I never forget and will strive to pay it forward within my life and to impact others the same way. I want to thank all of you for the hard work and dedication to this community and I hope you all strive to become more than what you are now because you all can. As they say, as one journey ends another begins. I want to give a special thanks to @101 | Hyperion, @154 | Zane T., @211 | Pach, @218 | Neptune, @301 | Enis, @.j a w z. and so many more. Thank you for believing in me and seeing me through in my career. You've taught me so much over the course of my journy and I cant thank you enough. Much Love, -Tokyo

181 | Alex 🚑 10/16/2022 2:23 PM
Restricted Roleplay Good afternoon! As most of you might know, the documentary came out about the Jefferey Dahmer and is widely popular right now. As you may know, he is a serial killer who gained popularity back in the 90's. As most people like to do, they RP as these new "big trends" but they always fall to involve FRP, Mass RDM, and more. I would like to formally announce that this type of RP is strictly not allowed for ANYONE in server! Public members to CC to even Staff aren't allowed to start or interact in this type of roleplay. Server rules may not specifically state this however if we were to list every rule, it would be 100 pages long. It is classified as serial killer RP which can NOT be handled by a public server! It is best to just not allow this kind of roleplay nor any mention of the person, place or things of serial killer RP. This means players may not have names such as the following:
- Jefferey Dahmer - Jeff Dahmer - Dahmer - Defferey Jahmer or any other serial killer's name while in server or Discord!
This will be the one and only warning for anyone on the staff team! Please react with a ✅ once you have read and understand this announcement! Signed, Head Of Staff Investigations - Alex R. @SARP | Server Staff

181 | Alex 🚑 10/18/2022 10:52 PM
Spectating/Being In RTO Good evening! It has come to my attention with a few issues lately of staff members spectating other staff members or no clipping near them while they are in RP. As per the staff guidelines that you all should know, you are to NEVER spectate another staff member unless you meet 2 conditions: 1)Admin+ and may only spectate those below you 2) You have given another staff member consent to spectate/TP As well, I would like to point out a work around that has been used lately. I don't want to see staff spectating a nearby non-staff member to claim they aren't "spectating" the staff member. This is unacceptable! Another note: If you are in server, no matter if you're on staff duty or not, you NEED to be in TeamSpeak somewhere. Be that AFK, Staff In Game, a CIV channel, or whatever else office. On Duty staff need to be able to reach you when needed to swap or need assistance. Please react with a ✅ once you have understood and read this announcement! Signed, Head Of Staff Investigations - Alex R. @SARP | Server Staff

101 | Hyperion 10/19/2022 9:43 AM
[ Community Directors - Coming Soon ] [ @SARP | Server Staff ] All, I wanted to give a brief update on a new rank that will be introduced into the community structure in the coming days. You may have already noticed Zooma's new assignment as Systems Director. These new Director slots will be expanded as needed in several key areas to allow those who are qualified to step up into more specialized and focused positions. This also allows another level of promotion advancement to those who have topped out at HA and may have been locked to that level for 6mo to a year as management slots are even harder to attain. The new Community Director rank will serve the needs of both management and the community. These slots will work very closely with the management member they are assigned to to ensure server projects and tasks are being completed in a timely and efficient manor. To qualify for one of these slots, a member must be highly active and have served at least 4 months as Head Administrator, without disciplinary or corrective actions and posses the skill and knowledge base to qualify for the specific slot. In the coming days a few new Directors, and Head Administrators will be announced. Thanks, Hyperion SARP | Community Ownership

181 | Alex 🚑 10/23/2022 5:15 PM
[HA Assignments] [ @SARP | Server Staff ] All, I have officially assigned the positions for the new Head Administrators accordingly. Please see below as these are effective immediately. I have full trust they will do well in these positions. @215 | Mitchell W. - Head Of Staff Recruitment Duties are as follows:
- Reviews staff applications regularly for any top candidates. - Accepts/Denies based on application, background and reviews. - Assigns proper roles in the discord for those accepted. - Ensures a swift timeline from acceptance to training complete. - Notifies the Senior Admins when new staff have been accepted. - Updates the Staff Roster with new candidates information. - Host open interviews if approved by management.
@302 | Jacob L. - Head Of Staff Personnel Duties are as follows:
- Responsible for the overall upkeep of all staff documents. - Responsible for updating and maintain the staff roster. - Responsible for reviewing and updating all LOA's. - Responsible for reviewing staff activity at the end of the month. - Issues activity notices at the end of the month for activity. - Responsible for ensuring staff roles are set correctly. - Works with the Staff Director to ensure guidelines are up to date
All notices of resignation or retirements shall go to one of these 2 first or myself directly. As well, stay tuned for additional promotions coming in the next few days for upcoming Admins and Senior Admins! Thanks, Alex R. SARP | Staff Team Director SARP | Community Director

181 | Alex 🚑 10/24/2022 11:32 AM
[ Promotions 10/24/22] [ @SARP | Server Staff ] Good morning! As stated before, it has come time to move forward some members of the team who we feel are ready to take on additional responsibilities within the team. These members have dedicated forth time, dedication, and proven themselves by going above and beyond. For the Administrator promotions, these individuals were voted upon by the Senior Staff Team based on multiple factors. Those are everything from activity, no disciplinary actions, leadership potential, exam scores and even seniority. Please give a big round of applause for the following individuals: Senior Moderators --> Administrators @Steph C. @3A-22 | CIV-45 | Lucas T. As well, we have decided to move forward some Admins to the rank of Senior Admin as we moved up two new Head Admins. Please remember that Senior Admin is a highly competitive and difficult rank to achieve within the staff team. These staff members must show the upmost respect, dedication, and leadership in the staff team. They have ben driven to reach the position they are at and I along with the Senior Staff feel they are ready to take on the tasks and responsibilities of a Senior Admin. Please congratulate the following individuals: Administrator --> Senior Administrator @CIV-04 | Jeremy R. @James A. Both of these guys are high positions within their departments with James being a Civilian Command Staff member and holding a supervisor position within BCSO. Jeremy also is holding a Department Staff rank in Certified Civilian and a member of the SASP. Both have proven leadership abilities and shall do great things! Thanks, Alex R. SARP | Staff Director SARP | Community Director (edited)

101 | Hyperion 10/28/2022 2:44 PM
[ My Available Hours ] [ @SARP | Server Staff ] All,
Just a quick note, my available hours will be changing as of this weekend. I am going to a 6a-6p CST rotating 12hr schedule, meaning I will be off every few days and every other weekend but I will no longer be on late at night generally speaking.
I will be available during the day for some things while at work but will not be home until around 7:30 EST each evening if I'm working. I will also not be available past about 9:00/10:00pm as I will be waking up at 3:30am each morning.
On my nights off I may be up slightly later but gone are the midnight to 3am days for me . I say this to ask that you not ping me for things late at night, use your chain of command. We have plenty of capable Admins, Directors and Management members who are online well into the night if needed.
*Side note: This by no means mean I will be disappearing, on the contrary I will have more days off during the week with this schedule, I simply wont be staying up late anymore. * Thanks, Hyper

101 | Hyperion 11/02/2022 3:19 PM
[ Staff Music Bot ]
Since we lost our previous music bot, I've upped our subscription level to Hydra to allow us to have 3 music bots so no more fighting over who's using the bot.
@Hydra & @Hydra 2 will be for general server members but @Hydra 3 will be for staff only, so you guys have your own.
Use it by going to #deleted-channel and doing the following: To request a song, simply join a VC, type the name of the song or artist in #deleted-channel and hit enter. To play a full Spotify Playlist, copy the playlist url link from spotify and post it in the channel.
Thanks!

110 | ozzymon68 11/06/2022 5:02 PM
[Jokes and comments] [@SARP | Server Staff] Please do not make jokes relating to people being pedophiles, rape, or anything of the sort while anything related to SARP. I may make some jokes but some people have came out and said they are uncomfortable or do not like these jokes being made. Some people have had issues with these things in the past. For those of us in the higher age rages, this can start a spur of rumors that can ruin reputation. If someone is actually doing something then please report it properly, don't just have conversations about it in offices. The next person to do any of these may be punished up to a blacklist. And no, we're not playing the game of "oh they can just leave if they don't like it". That's not how this works. Thank you for your compliance Signed, In game coordinator Ozzymon68

101 | Hyperion 11/07/2022 7:23 AM
[ Staff Conduct ] [ @SARP | Server Staff ] Similar to the above post, If I find out any of you are singling someone out and making jokes about someone's sex, religion, political beliefs, sexual orientation or any other personal descriptors you will risk being removed from the community in an instant. This is a zero tolerance rule and something that we take seriously I understand that this is a community of friends and sometimes we joke on one another. But you guys need to understand when to STOP. If someone tells you to stop then enough is enough. After that it becomes unwanted and harassing conduct which will very easily get you removed from the community, no matter your rank or assignment. Some of you need to show some maturity, our differences are what make us interesting. If everyone was the same this would be a very boring place. I don't give a shit if you don't agree with someone's beliefs or lifestyle, as long as they are respecting you, you are to respect them in return. Know where the line is, know when someone has had enough and be mature enough to understand when it needs to stop. Thanks, SARP Community Ownership (edited)

181 | Alex 🚑 11/07/2022 11:50 PM
Previous Announcements The recent announcements have been made because some people within the staff team have had issues with these things in the past. If you do not know, things like rape and pedophilia are things that can effect people for their entire lives. Ranging from depression, suicide, and even PTSD. These things are something that should not be joked about. PTSD is not a joke. This is something that affects people daily because they cannot get past it. So many veterans, those sexually assaulted, and many others have to deal with this every day. If you want to know exactly what PTSD is like then imagine something bad in your past. Let that memory constantly replay in your head, to the point you can't handle it. The amount of people that Ozzy, Jawz, Hyperion, and Justin may know that have PTSD is insane. The numbers are there, google it. These people live their lives with a few things that may bring them to the point of suicide. This is not a joke. At the end of the day, we are all here to escape things in our life and enjoy some video games with friends. I personally prefer a staff team where we all work together through our differences, respect each others life, and uplift each other. I will not tolerate bullying, "high school drama", or any disrespect to members of my team. If you feel its necessary to do any of these, you can leave now. Hand me a resignation and be done. If anyone from this point forward decides that "this is a joke" or continues this drama from here forward, you will be terminated! Signed, Alex R. | Staff Director @SARP | Server Staff

102 | Alex M. 11/08/2022 1:08 AM
[ Clarifying Jokes ]
Alright fellas, I've seen a lot of drama surrounding this topic and I've decided to intervene and clear this situation up so it is no longer talked about anymore. Jokes that relate to dark humor are acceptable to a certain extent.. When it comes to jokes being said within channels, the only channels these jokes should be addressed in are private offices. Jokes being said within the staff chat, staff rto, etc, will not be tolerated. People need to be in those channels for staff purposes and will remain professional at all times. Any reports of such behavior like this will be addressed with proper consequences.
If jokes are said within a channel and you are bothered by it you can either leave or mute the person until that jokingly behavior is no longer the topic of discussion anymore. People within this community have strong connections with each other to be able to make jokes amongst others. If a joke is said towards yourself and you don't appreciate it, stand up for yourself and address your concerns on that matter. If the person keeps continuing, that's when a report should be made following chain of command.
Signed, Community Advocate | Alex M. Please react with once you have read and acknowledge this message. I should see roughly 40 reactions as that is the number of active staff members defined by the staff roster!

101 | Hyperion 11/22/2022 5:44 PM
[ Question for Moderators/Senior Mods ] @SARP | Senior Moderator / @SARP | Moderator As we try to look at ways to elevate the burden of staff hours on a portion of the team, especially those who are dedicated to department hours, I would like your thoughts on this in the form of a poll. We are looking at removing the hourly requirement for Moderators/Senior Moderators, in return you will likely lose some perms as we can not simply give all staff perms without any hourly requirement. As a result, in exchange for no hourly requirement, noclip perms would be moved to Admin+. Mods & Senior Mods would retain ban perms and the vast majority of their current perms. There will be some small changes but noclip will be the most of note. You will still retain spectate and when responding to staff calls you would simply use the easy admin call claiming menu to TP to the report/person. You would also continue to bypass AOP restrictions and could TP to wherever needed out side AOP. Again, this change would remove your hourly requirement, you would simply help with calls when not in an RP scene and address things you encounter. You can also spectate others (non-staff) and address things as seen. You would be required to remain active in your departments, meeting their hourly requirements only. If you are willing to accept no hourly requirement in exchange for this perms change please let me know below. More questions will be answered in the coming days. (You would also not be required to join staff RTO when getting on the server) = Yes! I would be fine with this change. = No! I would rather keep an hourly requirement. Thanks, Hyper (edited)

We have agreed to try this change for a 30day period starting Dec 1st. Give it an honest shot and we will re-review it after 30days in a meeting to see what we think at that point. We will have a bit more info out in the coming week before the change begins. Thanks for all who attended! (edited)

101 | Hyperion 11/24/2022 10:36 PM
[ Warn/Kick/Ban Reason Shortcuts ] [ @SARP | Server Staff ] All, After the restart, there will be several "shortcuts" that you can use in your warn/kick/ban messages instead of having to type it all out. Obviously these only make sense in certain situations and we cant make one for everything, but it really helps speed things up for the common issues. How to use? It's simple, when you go to type a reason in the warning, kick or ban message you ONLY have to type the phase listed below and it will auto fill the entire rest of the message. This will save you tons of typing for common violations. Example: Typing "rdm" in the reason box will then auto fill the full reason once you hit enter, then show the following message in their kick/ban message: RDMing is not allowed! - (Please read over SARP's rules in the discord or use /help in game) The current list of shortcut phrases will be:
rdm - RDMing is not allowed! - (Please read over SARP's Rules in the discord or use /help in game) vdm - VDMing is not allowed! - (Please read over SARP's Rules in the discord or use /help in game) nitrp - NITRP in not allowed - You must be activley engaged in roleplay and remain in character at all times while in server. (Please read over SARP's rules in the discord or use /help in game) lang - Racist or Homophobic Terminology is not allowed in game! (Please read over SARP's rules in the discord or use /help in game) troll - Trolling, Malicious Threats/Conduct or Mass Rule breaking is not permitted! (Please read over SARP's rules in the discord or use /help in game) frp - Fail Roleplay such as speaking out of character, self reviving or interfering with a scene is not allowed! (Please read over SARP's rules in the discord or use /help in game) spam - Spamming such as chat spam or mic spam is not allowed. (Please read over SARP's rules in the discord or use /help in game) diss - Disrespecting staff or other members in game is not allowed. (Please read over SARP's rules in the discord or use /help in game) pt - Members may not run from LEOs or commit crimes while peacetime is enabled. (Please read over SARP's rules in the discord or use /help in game) copbait - Cop Baiting aka trying to solicit a reaction through unrealistic actions in front of an LEO is not allowed. (Please read over SARP's rules in the discord or use /help in game) personals - Driving or using any member's paid vehicle without verified permission is not allowed. (Please read over SARP's rules in the discord or use /help in game) driving - You must drive realistically while in server, GTA driving or excessively speeding in areas other than highways is not permitted. (Please read over SARP's rules in the discord or use /help in game) ltap - (LTAP) Leaving to Avoid Punishment is not allowed and will result in extended ban time. (Please read over SARP's rules in the discord or use /help in game) interfering - Players may not interfere in an ongoing roleplay scene and must leave if asked to do so. (Please read over SARP's rules in the discord or use /help in game)
More shortcuts may be added in the future if you guys want more! Thanks, Hyper (edited)
11
1

[ Warn/Kick/Ban Reason Shortcuts ] [ @SARP | Server Staff ] All, After the restart, there will be several "shortcuts" that you can use in your warn/kick/ban messages instead of having to type it all out. Obviously these only make sense in certain situations and we cant make one for everything, but it really helps speed things up for the common issues. How to use? It's simple, when you go to type a reason in the warning, kick or ban message you ONLY have to type the phase listed below and it will auto fill the entire rest of the message. This will save you tons of typing for common violations. Example: Typing "rdm" in the reason box will then auto fill the full reason once you hit enter, then show the following message in their kick/ban message: RDMing is not allowed! - (Please read over SARP's rules in the discord or use /help in game) The current list of shortcut phrases will be:
rdm - RDMing is not allowed! - (Please read over SARP's Rules in the discord or use /help in game) vdm - VDMing is not allowed! - (Please read over SARP's Rules in the discord or use /help in game) nitrp - NITRP in not allowed - You must be activley engaged in roleplay and remain in character at all times while in server. (Please read over SARP's rules in the discord or use /help in game) spam - Spamming such as chat spam or mic spam is not allowed. (Please read over SARP's rules in the discord or use /help in game) diss - Disrespecting staff or other members in game is not allowed. (Please read over SARP's rules in the discord or use /help in game) pt - Members may not run from LEOs or commit crimes while peacetime is enabled. (Please read over SARP's rules in the discord or use /help in game) copbait - Cop Baiting aka trying to solicit a reaction through unrealistic actions in front of an LEO is not allowed. (Please read over SARP's rules in the discord or use /help in game) personals - Driving or using any member's paid vehicle without verified permission is not allowed. (Please read over SARP's rules in the discord or use /help in game) driving - You must drive realistically while in server, GTA driving or excessively speeding in areas other than highways is not permitted. (Please read over SARP's rules in the discord or use /help in game) ltap - (LTAP) Leaving to Avoid Punishment is not allowed and will result in extended ban time. (Please read over SARP's rules in the discord or use /help in game)
More shortcuts may be added in the future if you guys want more! Thanks, Hyper (edited)

151 | Matt 11/27/2022 9:44 PM
[In-Game Professionalism/Maturity] - @SARP | Server Staff All, I know that I do not oversee staff anymore or have much say over you guys, but I will not let this one continue to slide. This has been an ongoing issue recently, and I am starting to see it more and more often, which is unacceptable. While you are in server, you must be professional and mature in all aspects of situations and scenarios. You ALL work as a team, you are not going against each other in any way. If you are going to be apart of this staff team, you are going to remain professional and mature throughout your whole time "serving" as a staff member. I personally will not be putting up with anymore of the lack of respect and maturity against your OWN staff members. Stop using in game chat as a place to cause arguments and disagreements. If this issue is that important, take it to DM's with the member and sort it out, or contact a HA. I want to see you all succeed, and prosper within the ranks and make this server even better than it already is. If I see any of this happen again, I will simply ask you to go off duty and pull your role(s) pending a discussion with Alex and the HA team. You guys and gals ALL work together, not against each other. Work as a team, or get removed from the team. Thank you all for your understanding, and I expect a reaction from each and every one of you that views this announcement. Signed, Matt H. | Community Director Community Operations

1
101 | Hyperion 11/29/2022 5:35 AM
[ In-Game Staff Chat ] [ @SARP | Server Staff ] All, we now have an ingame staff chat feature! This will be very useful when staff are not in RTO, especially once the new perms changes start in December. The in game staffchat will be viewable to all staff in game, it will be required that you have it turned on while in server, the only exception will be while live streaming to a platform such as twitch or youtube, then it must be turned off.
To turn on staff chat so that you can see it: /staffchat toggle You will then get ENABLED or DISABLED responses based it's the current state. To turn on your ability to type in staffchat use the command: /sc You will then see ON or OFF based on it's current state. This will set you to type in staffchat, simply type /sc again to go back to typing in normal chat.
It appears "viewing" of staff chat is toggled on by default, so you should not have to enable it unless you disable it. The only thing you will need to do is use the /sc command to turn on your ability to talk in it, then /sc again to go back to typing in normal chat. No matter if you are typing in staff chat or not, you will always also see the normal chat so you wont miss anything. Important: Please use this to discuss or request AOP, PT and other system changes. DO NOT get into arguments over requests. You can also discuss anything staff/game related using this. If you have any questions let me know! Thanks, Hyper (edited)

101 | Hyperion pinned a message to this channel. 11/29/2022 6:02 AM
101 | Hyperion 11/30/2022 2:34 AM
[ Staff Perms Update & Hourly Requirement ] [ @SARP | Server Staff ] Alright, as previously discussed with the Moderators and Senior Moderators last week, we will begin the new no hourly requirement/perms changes for Mods/Senior Mods after the restart. This means that upon the restart tonight, permissions will be updated and this will be in effect. I will be around for the next two days to address any errors or problems that arise. Biggest things to remember: - @SARP | Moderator / @SARP | Senior Moderator will have no hourly requirement but must maintain their department hours and ensure staff calls are being answered when in game. - Your activity will be judged on your department hours, staff calls answered and overall time in server. You do not need to report to staff RTO unless you are only staffing, you may go straight into game RTO and conduct your business there. Go to, and address calls in EasyAdmin in between RP scenes, do not ignore them and expect others to answer them all if you are not on an rp scene. You may also deal with anything you encounter in game obviously. - You must address all AOP/PT change requests to the highest staff member in the server, either by going up to staff RTO, poking, or using the new staffchat feature in game. - @SARP | Administrator/ @SARP | Senior Administrator / @SARP | Head Administrator You will now be responsible for running Staff RTO while on staff duty and must maintain your staff hours. At this time that hourly requirement remains the same. We will see how this month goes and re-evaluate from there. Also, please help with calls if they start to pile up. - Staff pings should only be issued when calls are backed up and there are not enough staff in game to handle them. - @SARP | Trial Moderator You will continue to have an hourly requirement to ensure you put forth effort into learning your new skills. Once promoted to Moderator you will transition to no hourly requirement. - Those of you who are not in a department, I expect you guys to be the MOST active staff in the server, we will monitor your calls answered and time in game to ensure you are active as staff is your only responsibility other than non-whitelisted RP or CC. Following this message will be a full breakdown of the new permissions. Most of you are aware of the biggest change with noclip, there are a few smaller changes as well but the majority remains the same. I will be around over the next two days so let me know if there are any issues. Thanks, lets see if this helps you guys overall! Hyper (edited)
02:38
[ Updated Staff Permissions ] Read the post above first Server Ownership: - All Permissions/Access Server Management: - All Staff Permissions - Server Stop/Start/Restart - View Bans/Unban Perms - Kick/Ban Immunity - TXAdmin Access Server Director: - All Staff Permissions - Kick/Ban Immunity Head Administrator: - All Staff Permissions Senior Administrator: - Warn, Kick, Slap, Temp-Ban, Perma-Ban - Noclip, Spectate, Screenshot, Freeze - 101 | Hyperion pinned a message to this channel. 11/30/2022 2:44 AM
101 | Hyperion 11/30/2022 12:37 PM
[ Staff Promotions & Miscellaneous Items ] [ @SARP | Server Staff ] All, Firstly if you have a dislike about a perm that may have been moved up a rank, hold tight, there will be several staff promotions coming soon which may grant you back that coveted perm. With staff hours not being a thing for Mods/SrMods we will be looking at your department activity and staff actions in server such as calls claimed, kicks, bans etc.. to ensure you are what would be considered "active". There is no "quota" or limit you must hit but general activity should be shown in server. Someone who only gets on once a week and has not been claiming calls or showing effort via legitimate kicks/bans would not be considered active. We will be looking at moving up some Moderators who have put in the time/effort up to Senior Mod along with some new Admin Promos as well. Things may be adjusted slightly as we move forward in this effort to relieve constraints on staff and encourage more department activity, so be patient and we shall see the end result together! There may be minor bumps in the road but we can discuss and resolve them as we go. Thank you for the dedication and service you give each day to the community! Thanks, Hyper

101 | Hyperion 11/30/2022 1:17 PM
[ Moderator Activity ] I have reviewed all of the Moderator's ingame time, calls answered and staff actions taken for the last month or so. I have made notes on the roster for those who are low in those areas. When looking at activity/promotions the following process will be taken:
1) Review in game time / department hours 2) Review calls claimed via EasyAdmin 3) Review staff actions (warns/kicks/bans)
To be considered "Active" as a moderator or senior moderator you need to keep these areas up. I understand some of you may not have as many calls to claim as others which is why we look at a combination of the three. Those of you who are noted as low, please try and improve these stats in December. If you think there was an error in the stats for the last month let me know. Thanks, Hyper (edited)

101 | Hyperion 12/03/2022 1:08 PM
[ Staff Team Inactivity ] All, firstly I want to thank the core group of staff at all ranks who are consistently active in game, answering calls, helping with issues, attending meetings and simply roleplaying. You guys shine each and every month and stand out in the crowd. Unfortunately there is a considerable lack of activity and participation on the part of many other members of the team which has gone on too long. Beginning the first week of January we will be doing a mass staff wipe of those who continue to not put in the effort and dedication we have all come to expect from one another. We have plenty of pending applications and it may be time to bring in a more active group rather than retain inactive members. Let this be fair warning, anyone who needs to up their dedication to the the team, you have one month to increase your activity. Many of you no longer have an hourly requirement, this means all you must do is get in game consistently, getting hours for your departments, answer calls as they come in when you are not on roleplay scenes and take actions as you encounter them. There is no easier way of showing activity. I hope many of you can get back in the groove of things and remain with us, especially as we start the new year and approach our 2 year anniversary along with the spring/summer growth season. Each of you were chosen because we believed you to be the type of quality staff member that we are looking for and I have no doubt each of you can continue to live up to that expectation. Thanks, Hyperion SARP | Community Ownership [ @SARP | Server Staff ]

Enis came to us a long time ago back in October of 2021 as a Senior Moderator. From there, due to his leadership skills and dedication to the team, he rose to become a Senior Admin. Enis has been a true blessing to both the staff team and the community. Enis has been a major player in many parts of our community, from his current position as the Sheriff in BCSO, to a Reserve Trooper in the SASP and a Senior Admin in the staff team. Enis' biggest draw as a staff member will always be his willingness to listen to others, his leadership skills, his ability to communicate with others, and his dedication to the team. I would like to join with all of the members of the staff team in thanking him for his steady hand in the leadership in the staff team and BCSO and wish him much luck and success in whatever he may do next. 101 | Hyperion 12/07/2022 9:24 PM
[ Train Script ] [ @SARP | Server Staff ] All,
Moderator+ will have access to the train script, tmods do not as they can not get through AOP boarders. The script will allow you to go to a marker on the map and spawn in the freight train. The train will then take you all around the map on the tracks. The train is speed limited to 80Mph and there is no ability to change tracks or anything else. It is simply peaceful train RP that adds a little bit of realism to the server.
Things to remember: - A car clear will remove the train. - If you accidently jump out of the train, it will continue on at the speed you left it at which is fine if you want basically an AI train. - When you are going though populated areas or going through a railroad crossings you must decrease your speed to under 50. - You may NOT stop the train just to block intersections. - You MAY conduct a train vs vehicle RP periodically but not constantly. - I only want ONE train spawned in at a time. If someone else is in the train, wait until they are done. How to spawn/enter/drive the train. - When you open the big map you will see a "T" icon in Los Santos. Go there, stand in the green circle and press "G". Once the train has spawned, have your ped look at the engine and press "F" - If you drive via controller simply drive it like any car. If you use keyboard, see the cheat sheet below. - When you are done with the train, please stop the train and /dv it and use EA to clear any train cars left on the track. - If you jump out of the train, you can re-enter it by either teleporting or no clipping ahead of it on the tracks and looking at the engine and pressing "F" just as you did when it was first spawned. - DO NOT DRIVE THE TRAIN IN REVERSE, IT LOOKS JANK TO EVERYONE ELSE.
The train is blacklisted to staff so no one else can enter the engine and drive it.
If the train is used to troll of fuck about in any way, it will be moved back to Management. Enjoy!! Hyper (edited)

101 | Hyperion 12/14/2022 5:05 PM
[ /Slash Commands ] [ @SARP | Server Staff ] All, Most staff action commands are now /slash commands and should be set per rank for access permissions. The old !commands for the below actions are disabled as of now. Common Commands:
- /warn [@user] [reason] - /mute [@user] [duration] [reason] - /unmute [@user] [reason] - /ban [@user] [reason] - /purge [number of messages] - /lockall [reason] - /unlockall [reason]
Obviously some of you have right click perms for muting and banning so this does not really pertain to you unless you simply want to use them. Thanks, Hyper (edited)

218 | Neptune 12/18/2022 2:04 PM
181 | Alex 🚑 12/19/2022 6:16 PM
[ Clarification On Banning Members ] Hello there. I just wanted to make some clarifications regarding banning members in server breaking rules. If you feel someone deserves a ban, then you need to follow a few steps:
- Make sure you have at least given them a warning or kick for a previous offense (unless a Tier III+ infraction) - Always try and clip the encounter. Not just the offense but the staff encounter as well (this helps with any reports made and saves your ass) - Sometimes you may not be able to clip an incident but it doesn't really mean you cant ban them if the encounter was seen by you yourself. If you did NOT witness the infraction, please view some evidence before banning. A member can always file a ban appeal so if you have no evidence of the ban, an appeal could be accepted. - You can ONLY ban someone at the moment you see an infraction occur! You can NOT at any point ban someone for something that happened 4 hours ago or even 3 weeks ago. The only exception is a BAN ON SIGHT!
Following these few tips will ensure you are following guidelines and you can avoid disciplinary action. Thanks for your time. Signed, SARP Staff Director - Alex R. @SARP | Server Staff
13
1
181 | Alex 🚑 12/23/2022 6:35 PM
[ A Few Actions Need Correcting ] Hello everyone. Hopefully you guys have a great Christmas or whatever holiday you celebrate! While being in server, a few issues have been prevalent that are drastically affecting the member count, quality of RP, and creating unnecessary "high school drama". I would first like to say that at times I personally have done some stupid things in server but I know what's too far and I fix it. Please, never follow some of the actions I do at times as I separate myself from AOP players. Peacetime We have said it before and I will say it again (it's also in staff guidelines), peacetime should never be left on for any period longer than 20 minutes! I don't care if people ask about it, tell them it will go off after the cooldown is. Nobody wants to join server when PT is always on. Discussions In VC Per staff guidelines and against what a lot of people say, you are NOT to be using racial slurs, derogatory statements against religion, race, gender, sexual orientation or other offensive materials in ANY SARP VC! If you wish to speak like this, go to a separate non-SARP related Discord, plenty of members have their own personal discords. Hopefully you guys have a very Merry Christmas! Please take some time and enjoy our server events taking place in the next few days in BCSO, CC, and more! Signed, Staff Director - Alex R. @SARP | Server Staff

101 | Hyperion 12/28/2022 10:17 PM
[ Unmarked Staff Fleet ] All, The new unmarked staff fleet is in game and usable now! These vehicles are mostly average vehicles meant to blend in but have completely hidden green lighting. You may drive the vehicle at your current rank and everything below it. The lights are ONLY to be used during a staff actions, staff scenes type incidents. You may RP in these cars, however if someone is seen using the lights for no apparent reason or violating server guidelines (unrealistic driving) you will have your vehicle privileges suspended for a week, second violation will be a staff suspension. The staff hellcat will remain as our only "marked" vehicle and should only be used in rare occasions when a marked staff car is needed. This may include blocking an area off, server event etc.. No one should be simply driving it around.
Management -- Aventador Director -- Ford GT Head Admin -- Corvette - staff_corvette Senior Admin -- Cadillac staff_caddy Admin -- Mustang - staff_mustang Senior Mod -- Raptor - staff_raptor Moderator -- MachE - staff_mache trialmod -- Bronco - staff_bronco
All have blacklisted to staff, the bronco's lights will be working later tonight. All will be updated in #📋・staff-information shortly. [ @SARP | Server Staff ] Thanks, Hyper (edited)

101 | Hyperion 12/29/2022 8:25 AM
[ Los Santos AOP ] All, For the foreseeable future, if moving AOP to Los Santos please simply use the normal full Los Santos AOP. There are several reasons for this, it makes no sense to purchase property then not be allowed access to it via AOP restrictions in LS, it also makes no sense to pay for special event maps for holidays and other great MLOs if AOP constantly restricts members from being able to travel to them. Also, gangs will never build up if they are constantly cut off from their compounds and areas within LS. Also, If we are to allow jobs again in the near future a restrictive AOP in LS will not allow for proper use. Simply allow folks to spread out in LS when moved there. If player count is very low you may still use mirror park. However if we're at 25-30 and you want to get out of Blaine County, simply go full LS so that everyone has access/freedom to the areas they desire to create roleplay in while in the city. Thanks, Hyper [ @SARP | Server Staff ]

101 | Hyperion 12/31/2022 9:35 PM
[ Legion Square Fire Works Script ] @SARP | Server Staff All, For those who do not know and want to use it tonight, the New Years map in Legion Square has a hidden fire works script in it. To use it, simply go to Legion Square at night and use the command /fireround this will set off a fire works display that will go all around Legion Square. You can use the command multiple times spaced out to increase the show size but DO NOT spam it. You can also use the fireworks script that is blacklisted to staff /sf for color fire works as well. Thanks, Hyper
18
211 | Pach 01/01/2023 10:09 PM
Important Announcement Good evening ladies and gentlemen, First things first, Happy New Year! I hope you all had an amazing 2022, because I know I did. I met some very special individuals, both in the server and IRL. Let's all hope for an even better 2023! Now that that's out of the way I have some news that I need to share with all of you... Retirement These past few years have been a blast playing the game we all know as GTA V Roleplay, but like every other game you'll ever play, it get's repetitive. As I'm sure most of you know, I haven't been playing in the server as much these past 5 months, and unfortunately, I have burned my passion for FiveM almost completely. My passion for roleplay has been drained since August/October of 2022, however running the server through my administrative duties didn't get affected until December, give or take. Which is why I've decided to put in my two weeks that way someone else can put in the work that I can't. This wasn't an easy decision to make, and I wish I could stay as your Department's Liaison for even longer time and hate to cut it short as I've only been Management for a year, but I've gotta do what's best for the server, and at the moment, what's best for the server isn't me. I hope you all understand where I'm coming from. Special Thank You(s) First and formost I want to give the biggest heartfilled thank you to @Charlie S.! You first invited me here when the server wasn't even started yet to help you develop the EUP, department fleet, etc. You sir are
22:09
the whole reason I've even been playing FiveM for the past year and half, that led me to make even more friendships that'll last years. You promoted me to Sheriff, which led my destination to Department Liaison. I wouldn't be here without you, so once again, thank you. @101 | Hyperion my man. You've taught me a lot, first when working under you as a regular Moderator, all the way till now, working with you hand-in-hand trying to make our departments the best that they possibly can be. Throughout my whole journey here in SARP, you were my biggest mentor, and for that, thank you. There are dozens apon dozens of people that I wish I can thank in this message, but I would need the energy to write a whole five page article. So, to keep it short and sweet, thank you; Alex; Thompson; Ozzy; Casey; Isaac; Zane; Tokyo; Enis; Alex #2; Owen; and plenty more! Goodbye With all that said, I will still be around here and there, popping around within the VC's of this Discord, so this won't be the last you see of me! But, I will still miss working with all of you. I do want to say I will be doing my last patrol as Department Liaison right now, so if you want to join me, hop on the server with me! Thank you. Signed, Community Management
San Andreas Roleplay - @SARP | Server Staff

198 | Morning 01/04/2023 12:23 PM
[ Staff Confidentially/Zero Tolerance Reminder ] All, I have seen an increase in staff members either forgetting or not caring about the ZERO tolerance staff confidentiality rule, this is the first disclaimer you agree to when joining the staff team. This is also pinned within most staff directory channels as an important reminder The current guideline is - "No Staff Member shall leak any documents or information found within the Staff Directory" under the ZERO tolerance guidelines. The violation of this guideline is punishable by up to a Termination and Blacklist from the SARP Staff Team. This includes but is not limited to.
- Posting staff information outside of the Staff Directory in any SARP Discord/any Discord/Discord section. - Sending private DMs of information within the Staff Directory to non staff members. - Discussing staff information with non staff members within a VC. - Sending clips of staff information including but not limited to staff RTO conversations, conversations within VC relating to staff, clips of staff sits/staff actions. - Livestreaming while on duty as staff/any staff actions/channels.
Signed, Head of Staff Investigations - Morning @SARP | Server Staff

4
101 | Hyperion 01/13/2023 8:52 PM
[ Staff Conduct ] [ @SARP | Server Staff ]
All, Any community that hopes to maintain a level of structure and accountability must have and enforce zero tolerance guidelines. Staff are not above these and in fact should be well aware of what is expected of them. After speaking with members of Management and the Head Admins this afternoon it appears a clear statement needs to be made. For members of this team, one of the "zero tolerance" red lines that is not to be crossed is the use of the words "nigger" and "faggot" in any channel of the SARP discord including VC offices as well as teamspeak and obviously the gaming server. If you lack the ability to control yourself and use these words anywhere in this discord there will be repercussions, from suspensions, demotions or removal. It disappoints me that I have to spell this out in such blatant terms, however it appears the message has not been clear in the past. I have no issues with most of the dark humor that we joking discuss in offices, but there has to be a limit if we are to maintain our status as a well run, respectable community. Also remember that management members may ask that you reframe from discussing certain topics in their specific offices such as rape or pedophile jokes. I would ask that you have the maturity to respect their wishes when in their offices. Its simply common sense. In conclusion, my best advice for this team is, if you would mute, kick or ban someone for what they have said or done, then you are expected to hold yourself to that standard as well and avoid that same behavior. I hope this to be the last time this must be brought up. I don't believe this is asking too much, avoid the use of two words guys, that's all we're asking. Any other complaints may be handled on a case by case basis but these two terms are where we draw a hard line. I know for most of you this is a non-issue and for that I appreciate your professionalism.
Reference: #📌・server-rules - Section 1.01 Zero Tolerance Rules Please react using ✅ indicating you understand and will comply. Thanks, SARP Ownership & Management

101 | Hyperion 01/16/2023 11:29 PM
[ FPS Booster ] All, Those of you who were having frame issues the past few days, if you are using the /fps script to try and help with frames, try doing /fps reset and see if it returns to normal. I was using the script the past two days and it went from good to terrible today and I had to turn it off. Once I reset it to normal I went back to normal good frames. If this occurs with you as well let me know as if the script is bugging out i may need to remove it from #📊・increase-fps Thanks, Hyper

181 | Alex 🚑 01/17/2023 8:53 PM
[ Staff Guidelines Updated ] Hello, I would like to announce that the staff guidelines have been updated to show some current changes and a few additional guidelines set. See the change log below:
- Chain of Command updated - Added policy: "No staff member shall join the server while intoxicated by any means" - Updated Staff Activity to show Moderator and Senior Moderator activity policy - Updated Reserve Staff requirements - Update to show current use of staff chat in game but to still include RTO - Updated to show Active Staff vs "non-active staff" i.e. Mod/SM - Added Car/Ped/Prop Clear in EA - Updated call claiming to new EA ~ Added new policy: May not come back to team from retirement until 30 days from retirement, may not come back from retirement more than 2x in 1 year - Added Staff Of The Month - Updated Discord Log Channels to show current - Make sure Kick/Ban/Warn Updated ~ Updated Staff Fleet - Added Headings To Create Outline
Please reread through the guidelines to ensure you know these changes and follow them effective immediately! Signed, Staff Coordinator | Alex R. @SARP | Server Staff

181 | Alex 🚑 01/22/2023 8:43 PM
⏳ [ Staff Activity ] Hello and good evening! I wanted to remind everyone of the activity check that will occur Jan 31st, 2023 for the month of January. December was exempt so if you were marked low before December, you can still be marked low now for January. Keep in mind that a Low x2 Notice will result in Demotion one rank. If you are marked Low x3, you face termination from the team for inactivity. I would like to say that inactivity wont be tolerated in this team especially to those who hold a supervisory position in staff. We have lowered the activity requirements for Admin+ and implemented the "reserve" status for Moderators and Senior Moderators where your activity is based on department hours, staff calls answered, and moderation actions in server. All will be calculated and members will be notified at the end of the month. Currently, there are 9 days left in this month so now would be a great time to squeeze any last hours in you need! Signed, Staff Coordinator | Alex R. @SARP | Server Staff

101 | Hyperion 02/05/2023 6:01 PM
[ Noclip vs Hourly Requirement ] [ @SARP | Server Staff ] All,
Recently many of you have requested that noclip be brought back to Senior Mod+ in exchange for the hourly requirement. If this is done, Moderator will remain no hourly requirement and no noclip so that department members may remain in staff to assist while getting their department hours.
However, everyone Senior Moderator and up would again have an hourly requirement and MUST go on active staff duty during those hours if they wish to have no clip perms again.
Now, those who were moved down to Senior Mod from Admin due to not being able to accommodate the hourly requirement, will be moved to Moderator. Please vote below: ✅ - Yes, im in favor! / ❌ - No, no change. (edited)

151 | Matt 02/14/2023 11:37 PM
Staff RTO - In Game Policies - @SARP | Server Staff Good evening, I am making this quick announcement regarding something that I have seen lately, and I would like to make sure that it is clarified. Trial Moderators should NOT be left alone in Staff RTO, because they are unable to ban members (if necessary). Of course, they still have warn/kick perms, but sometimes a ban is necessary, and if they don't have anyone to help administer it, what are they going to do? That's why there should always be someone there to help out a T-Mod. Now, I understand that the whole staff activity clock in has gone back and forth, but that does not mean we leave them alone with no help. This is just a simple reminder to you all, let's try to refrain from this as much as possible! You guys are all doing great and I am loving the activity and how well you are responding to certain situations. There has been minimal staff reports recently, and almost all of them are deemed invalid or false. That is a good thing, because that means you are all doing your job well. Keep up the hard work! Regards, Matt H. - Director of Community Operations

181 | Alex 🚑 02/24/2023 12:50 PM
[ Overall Staff Team Health & Feedback ] Over the past few weeks I feel the conduct and communication of policies, important information and more has been less than sufficient. Of course, some things are confidential by rank but not everything is. I want to step in and find a proper solution to help build strong communication between lower staff and higher staff. I want to increase communication of even just issues between staff members in general. As the Staff Coordinator I have always said that communication is key as well as trust in being an effective leader. We are called the Staff TEAM for a reason! So far, I have 2 solutions to help: 1.) I would like your guys' (and gal) input on possibly hosting some game/movie nights for the team every month. There are plenty of free Steam/Epic games and such that are perfect for multiple people to play. If you would like to suggest some, look at number 2 below. 2.) I have created a feedback form for the effectiveness of myself and the Admin+ team. I kindly ask that everyone give feedback and be completely honest. You may submit anonymously or not, entirely up to you. You may suggest game/movie ideas within the form at the end! I have been planning a big staff meeting to kind of gauge where we are plus we haven't had one since December! Most likely will be hosted on a Sunday night by me or another HA. Feedback Form: https://forms.gle/5wR5q4P9rroqWyYM8 Have a great weekend! Signed, Staff TEAM Coordinator - Alex R. @SARP | Server Staff
Senior Staff Feedback
We would love to hear your thoughts or feedback on how we can improve your experience here in the SARP Staff Team!

181 | Alex 🚑 pinned a message to this channel. 02/24/2023 12:50 PM
181 | Alex 🚑 03/02/2023 9:46 AM
[ Activity Updates/Other Important Updates] Good morning SARP Staff Team! I want to bring some updates on a few items to keep you in the loop and continue good communication. Like my previous announcement, I feel communication can be rough at times so I want to list a few key updates for you. First, Senior Moderators will be REQUIRED to clock 15hrs a month as of 03/02/2023. This was a result of a poll to allow no clip back to Senior Moderators. This means you must maintain your department hours like before but also dedicate at least 15hr a month to staffing the server. Secondly, if you are a @SARP | Moderator and want to move up to a Senior Moderator at any point in the future, please react with a :SARP_Tick: below! If you are not a moderator wanting to move up, please DO NOT react with this reaction!! Third, if you are to move up to the position of Administrator, you must meet the requirements. They are: Be a Senior Moderator, Submit a LOI found under the #📋・staff-information , Take the Admin exam when they are hosted by a HA+, and have no disciplinary action in the past 90 days. Stay tuned for more updates! Signed, Staff Coordinator | Alex R. @SARP | Server Staff

181 | Alex 🚑 03/07/2023 3:20 PM
Staff Meeting All, I will be hosting a staff meeting this weekend to give some updates and get some feedback from the team. Please bring any questions or concerns to the meeting so they can be addressed! Topics To Be Covered
- Update To Senior Moderator Activity - Conduct While Staffing - Steps To Become Admin - Staff Of The Month Update - Chain Of Command - Questions
You may submit meeting talking points with the link below. Date: 03/12/2023, Sunday Time: 7PM EST Link: https://forms.gle/2iTiDhLBytd4Xi8bA Regards, Staff Coordinator - Alex R. @SARP | Server Staff

215 | Mitchell W. 03/07/2023 10:25 PM
Staff Promotion(s) - @SARP | Server Staff Good evening everyone, we've got ourselves a few promotions for some of our Trial Moderators. Please help me in congratulating these gentlemen on their promotions!! These guys have been Trial Moderators for a full month now, and we appreciate the hard work they've put forth. --> @Declan P. @Johnny R @Jack S. Congratulations gentlemen. Keep in mind you will now have access to Ban Permissions as well as a few other permissions. I ask that you maintain your Staff Activity as well as your Department Activity as well. Signed, Staff Director | Mitchell W.

Event Details
181 | Alex 🚑 03/12/2023 7:00 PM
@SARP | Server Staff - Meeting starts in 5 minutes. If you are available to join, please do. A few updates and important information to hear and an ability to have questions answered!
101 | Hyperion
[ Welcome, new Trial Moderators! ] [ @SARP | Trial Moderator ] All, Welcome to the team and congratulations on being accepted. Please take some time read over all the channels, documents and announcements. Be sure to go back and look at pinned messages in channels as well. It is very important that you gain knowledge quickly and continue to learn over the next several weeks. While I commend you for effort to get here I also give you words of warning. As trial moderators you are on very thin ice and must ensure you are following all server rules and staff guidelines to prove your self the type of staff member we wish to retain. I will say this once, you are to treat members of the community with respect, do not talk down to anyone and ensure that you are always operating in a professional manner. Never abuse your staff permissions or use them to gain any edge in roleplay. Be a team player, you may not like everyone on the team but you are required to work with them to get the job done. You are held to a higher standard and today marks the start of your journey with the team. It is true that it's hard to make it on the staff team, however it can be even harder to remain on the staff team if you make poor decisions. Again, congrats to all who were accepted! Thanks, Hyper (edited)
101 | Hyperion 03/13/2023 10:15 PM
[ Welcome T-Mods ] [ @SARP | Trial Moderator ] All, Congrats on being accepted into the staff team, as a a staff member you are stepping up and take a small part of the ownership and representation of the server and community. I wish you all the best and thank you for your dedication to the community. I would direct you to the reference the reply at the top of this announcement for a prior announcement and message to all new trial moderators. Thank you, Hyper
